destinations.title: Karlovy Vary
destinations.description: (Carlsbad) — historic (and biggest Czech) spa resort, especially popular with German and Russian tourist groups

destinations.title: Kutná Hora
destinations.description: historical town with famous Saint Barbara cathedral, old silver mines and the Chapel of All Saints, which is decorated with thousands of human bones

destinations.title: Olomouc
destinations.description: (Holomóc or Olomóc) — riverside university town with a thousand-year history and the second-largest historical centre in the Czech Republic

destinations.title: Ostrava
destinations.description: a vibrant local subculture and long history of coal mining and heavy industry

destinations.title: Pilsen
destinations.description: (Plzeň) — home of the original Pilsner Urquell beer, and the largest city in West Bohemia

destinations.title: Bohemian Paradise
destinations.description: (Český ráj) – A region of towering rock formations and isolated castles located north-east of Prague. The gateway city of Jičín is an interesting destination in its own right, but Turnov is closer to most of the castles and rock formations. The twin towers of the ruined castle Trosky are a symbol of the area and can be climbed for the views

destinations.title: Karlštejn
destinations.description: – and the holy cave monastery: Hiking trip to the famous castle and an off-the-beaten-track monastery

destinations.title: Giant Mountains National Park
destinations.description: (Giant Mountains) – The highest mountains in the Czech Republic along the Polish border. Most popular Czech skiing resorts are here, such as Špindlerův Mlýn, however considered overpriced by locals.

destinations.title: Litomysl
destinations.description: – A beautiful small town in East Bohemia. The renaissance main square and chateau are among the Czech Republic's prettiest and the town has been home to many important and influential artists, including composer Bedřich Smetana, sculptor Olbram Zoubek and painter Josef Váchal. There are two international opera festivals at the chateau each year.

destinations.title: Mariánské Lázně
destinations.description: – A spa town in Western Bohemia.

destinations.title: Mutenice Wine Region
destinations.description: – Some of the best vineyards in the Czech Republic and totally off the well-beaten tourist path

destinations.title: Nové Město na Moravě
destinations.description: – Cross country skiing resort. The race of Tour de Ski takes place here.

destinations.title: Terezín
destinations.description: – A red-brick baroque fortress 70 km north of Prague beside the Ohře river. It was used during World War II as a Jewish ghetto and concentration camp.

destinations.title: Znojmo
destinations.description: – The Rotunda of the Virgin Mary and St Catherine with the oldest frescoes in the Czech Republic.

Denmark.title: Denmark
Denmark.summary: Denmark (Danish: Danmark) is the smallest of the Nordic countries. Denmark, the Faroe Islands and Greenland are collectively and formally known as The Danish Realm (Det Danske Rige). While all three have their own constituent parliaments, they are also part of The Kingdom of Denmark with Queen Margrethe II as symbolic monarch.
Denmark.description: Denmark (Danish: Danmark) is the smallest of the Nordic countries. Denmark, the Faroe Islands and Greenland are collectively and formally known as The Danish Realm (Det Danske Rige). While all three have their own constituent parliaments, they are also part of The Kingdom of Denmark with Queen Margrethe II as symbolic monarch.

sights.title: Dyrehavsbakken
sights.description: Danish amusement park referred to informally as Bakken

sights.title: Svendborg
sights.description: town in the municipality with the same name in Denmark

destinations.title: Copenhagen
destinations.description: (København) – Denmark's capital and largest city with a population of 1.2 million in its metropolitan area and a vast number of offers for cultural experiences and  interesting shopping inspired with Danish design traditions.

destinations.title: Aalborg
destinations.description: – An old port town and industrial centre with a historic and picturesque city centre, including the rowdy street of Jomfru Ane Gade; featuring some of the most vibrant night life in the country.

destinations.title: Aarhus
destinations.description: – the largest city on the Jutland peninsula and Denmark's second largest city, with a population of 320,000 in its metropolitan area. As an educational centre, Aarhus offers many cultural experiences and has a vibrant and diverse night life. Also being a centre of food production and conferences, Aarhus is among the best places in Denmark to eat. The brilliant Old Town open air museum with reconstructed old historic timber-framed buildings from all over Denmark, is one of the most popular attractions in the country.

destinations.title: Esbjerg
destinations.description: – Denmark's hub for the fishing and offshore oil and gas industry, and a short 15-minute ferry ride away from the cosy island of Fanø. The large Wadden Sea National Park is close to Esbjerg.

destinations.title: Nykøbing Falster
destinations.description: – nestled by a picturesque fjord, you can explore the old abbey, the castle, or set out to the spectacular chalk cliffs of Møn or the island's good beaches

destinations.title: Odense
destinations.description: – the main city of the island of Funen, and Denmark's third largest city, known as the birthplace of fairytale writer Hans Christian Andersen. The old historic town centre features cosy winding cobbled streets with interesting streetscapes of both medieval listed buildings and modern architecture. The countryside is also of interest, including the open air museum The Funen Village.

destinations.title: Roskilde
destinations.description: – half an hour from Copenhagen is a picturesquely placed city, hosting a world heritage listed cathedral as well as a great Viking ship museum.

destinations.title: Skagen
destinations.description: – the most northern point of the mainland, this sleepy fishing town bursts into life during summer. It is the place to watch as two oceans meet at the "tip of Denmark", bike around the scenic surroundings and dine on excellent seafood. It is among the most popular summer destinations in the country, including that of the Copenhagen rich and famous.

destinations.title: Sønderborg
destinations.description: – discover Danish mentality in a city where Denmark finally conceded its superpower ambitions, and wander through the old castle or the royal palace of Gråsten.

destinations.title: Anholt
destinations.description: – more than 45 km from nearest mainland and pretty much right between Sweden and Denmark, this secluded island offers the largest desert in Northern Europe and one of Scandinavia's largest seal populations.

destinations.title: Ertholmene
destinations.description: – this small group of islands, governed by the Ministry of Defence, makes up for Denmark's most eastern land and home to a large a bird reserve, as well as old defence installations.

destinations.title: Femø
destinations.description: – most famous for being one of the first bastions for the women's rights movement, it now attracts lesbians and feminists, while priding itself in welcoming all women.

destinations.title: Fanø
destinations.description: – a 16 km long and 5 km wide island, with an unusual large mount of different natural environments on a small area: Sand, heath, meadow and pine wood.

destinations.title: Hirsholmene
destinations.description: – a group of 10 small islands 7 km to the northeast of Frederikshavn, noted for its high population of birds, but also home to some excellent beaches and a relatively large number of World War II-era bunkers.

destinations.title: Kongernes Nordsjælland National Park
destinations.description: – brand new national park covering the old hunting grounds of ancient kings.

destinations.title: Læsø
destinations.description: – get away from it all in this remote island in Denmark's "desert belt", ride through the sand dunes on horseback and see unique farmhouses with seaweed roofs.

destinations.title: Samsø
destinations.description: – Denmark's "greenest" island has garnered international attention since the heat and energy consumption on the island is exclusively produced locally by renewable sources. Samsø is home to the annual music festival Samsø Festival, sporting itself as Denmark's "hyggeligste" (i.e. most cosy).

destinations.title: Stevns Cliff
destinations.description: – a 65 million year old cliff made up of lime and chalk, which stretches more than 12 km on the shoreline and up to 41m above sea-level.

Djibouti.title: Djibouti
Djibouti.summary: Djibouti is in the Horn peninsula, bordered by Eritrea to the north, Ethiopia to the west and south, and Somaliland to the southeast.  The Gulf of Aden lies to the east. The country can be divided into three regions; the coastal plain and volcanic plateaus in the central and southern parts of the country and the mountain ranges in the north. Much of the country is wasteland with virtually no arable land.
Djibouti.description: Djibouti is in the Horn peninsula, bordered by Eritrea to the north, Ethiopia to the west and south, and Somaliland to the southeast.  The Gulf of Aden lies to the east. The country can be divided into three regions; the coastal plain and volcanic plateaus in the central and southern parts of the country and the mountain ranges in the north. Much of the country is wasteland with virtually no arable land.

Dominica.title: Dominica
Dominica.summary: Dominica is a Caribbean island country between the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean, about one-half of the way from Puerto Rico to Trinidad and Tobago. It is often known as "The Nature Island of the Caribbean" due to its spectacular, lush, and varied flora and fauna, which are protected by an extensive natural park system.  The most mountainous island of the Lesser Antilles, its volcanic peaks are cones of lava craters and include Boiling Lake, the second-largest thermally active lake in the world.
Dominica.description: Dominica is a Caribbean island country between the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean, about one-half of the way from Puerto Rico to Trinidad and Tobago. It is often known as "The Nature Island of the Caribbean" due to its spectacular, lush, and varied flora and fauna, which are protected by an extensive natural park system.  The most mountainous island of the Lesser Antilles, its volcanic peaks are cones of lava craters and include Boiling Lake, the second-largest thermally active lake in the world.

destinations.title: Roseau
destinations.description: Capital

destinations.title: Portsmouth (Dominica)
destinations.description: The second largest city in Dominica.  Ross University, a large American medical school is situated nearby.

destinations.title: Scott's Head
destinations.description: Beautiful village at the end of the road on the southwest corner.  Scott's Head wraps around the lip of a gently curved bay that happens to be the ancient crater of a volcano.  Luckily for divers you can bring your own snorkel or scuba gear and walk out and admire what remains, a 160 meter deep coral lined hole that stretches for hundreds of meters.  Several quaint shacks serve decent fare for decent prices.  Villagers are curious as visitors are few.  The main road ends at a small point on a  hill that provides stunning views of both Scott's Head below and Roseau to the north.

destinations.title: Calibishie
destinations.description: Stretching from the rugged mountains of Pennville, through the picturesque fishing village of Calibishie to the crashing surf of the Marigot beaches, the Calibishie Coast is one of the few areas in the world where you can travel from the seashore to the littoral forest to the rain forest in little more than a mile. Experience palm-fringed beaches, freshwater rivers with secluded bathing pools, tumbling waterfalls and the soft wonder of the rain forest with its exotic birds and lush vegetation, all in a days' walk.

destinations.title: St. Joseph (Dominica)
destinations.description: Situated halfway up Dominica's West Coast, St. Joseph is one of the more urbanised villages on the island. Historically called "Senjo," the village is known for its fishing, cricket playing and vibrant festivals. While not typically on the tourist trail, it is near the popular Mero Beach and Layou River. St. Joseph was featured in the 1988 Demi Moore movie, The Seventh Sign.

destinations.title: Marigot (Dominica)
destinations.description: Melville Hall

destinations.title: Morne Trois Pitons National Park
destinations.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, it contains many attractions such as the Boiling Lake, the Freshwater Lake, Boeri Lake and Middleham Falls. Boiling Lake is a 12-mile round trip hike (8 hours), very steep mostly on steps and switchbacks.  A guide is recommended for inexperienced back country hikers, the terrain is rough especially when wet (which it almost always is).  The trail is well marked most of the way.  The trail is indistinct in the Valley of Desolation but picks up again where vegetation begins. The hike is stunning and the bare volcanic mountain tops make for unforgettable views of rolling mountain tops and steamy volcanic vents.  Trail ends at the Boiling Lake, a 100 meter wide lake that is being heated by a volcanic vent and is boiling.

Dominican Republic.title: Dominican Republic
Dominican Republic.summary: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern five-eighths of the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. The western three-eighths of Hispaniola is occupied by the country of Haiti. To the north lies the North Atlantic Ocean, while the Caribbean Sea lies to the south.

The western three-eighths of Hispaniola is occupied by the country of Haiti. To the north lies the North Atlantic Ocean, while the Caribbean Sea lies to the south.

East Timor.title: East Timor
East Timor.summary: The Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste, commonly known as East Timor (Tetum: Timór Lorosa'e), sits at the transition area between Southeast Asia and Oceania. It lies northwest of Australia in the Lesser Sunda Islands at the eastern end of the Indonesian archipelago. East Timor includes the eastern half of the island of Timor, the Oecussi (Ambeno) region on the northwest portion of the island of Timor, and the small islands of Atauro and Jaco. It is one of only two countries in Asia with a Roman Catholic majority, the other one being the Philippines. Indonesia and East Timor are the only Asian countries reaching south of the Equator, and of them East Timor is the only country entirely in the Southern Hemisphere.
East Timor.description: The Democratic Republic of Timor-Leste, commonly known as East Timor (Tetum: Timór Lorosa'e), sits at the transition area between Southeast Asia and Oceania. Egypt.title: Egypt
Egypt.summary: The Arab Republic of Egypt (Arabic: مصر, màSr) is in north-eastern Africa. Egypt is perhaps best known as the home of the ancient Egyptian civilization, with its art, temples, hieroglyphs, mummies, and above all, its pyramids. Less well-known is Egypt's Coptic Christian and Muslim heritage, with ancient churches, monasteries and mosques dotted across the landscape. Egypt stimulates the imagination of western tourists like few other countries and is probably one of the most popular tourist destinations world-wide.

Equatorial Guinea.title: Equatorial Guinea
Equatorial Guinea.summary: Equatorial Guinea is a small country in West Africa, divided into two parts, the mainland and the islands. The mainland is wedged between Cameroon and Gabon. Unique among sub-Saharan countries, it was a Spanish colony, whose only other African colony was Western Sahara. It is one of the largest oil producers in Sub-Sahara, behind Angola and Nigeria.

Estonia.title: Estonia
Estonia.summary: Estonia (Estonian: Eesti) is the northernmost and smallest of the Baltic states. While the country has charming old towns and heritage back to the Hanseatic League, it is a leader in technology.

destinations.title: Tallinn
destinations.description: – The capital, and financial and cosmopolitan centre of Estonia, with a medieval Old Town. Beautiful and expensive (compared to other Estonian towns).

destinations.title: Tartu
destinations.description: – Museum-rich and hanseatic city on the banks of the Emajõgi River. Also, Estonia's second-largest and oldest city, intellectual hub famous for its universities, and a lively student city.

destinations.title: Narva
destinations.description: – Estonia's eastern-most and third largest city, on the Narva River, which is the border with Russia. Famous for the Hermann castle, right opposite of the Ivangorod's castle, and the Kreenholm factories. Even though it might seem grey and dull.

destinations.title: Pärnu
destinations.description: – Estonia's 4th largest city and the summer capital of Estonia, popular for its balneo-therapy complexes and spa centres, surrounded by numerous beaches.

destinations.title: Rakvere
destinations.description: – Estonia's fifth largest city, east of Tallinn, famous for its Punk and Rock festivals and spirit.

destinations.title: Haapsalu
destinations.description: – "Venice of the north", and a major seaside resort and medium-sized port city, good for visiting spas, taking mud baths, sailing, swimming, interesting monuments of the middle ages, like the cathedral and the Ruins of Haapsalu Castle, and the picturesque Railway Museum.

destinations.title: Viljandi
destinations.description: – A beautiful, ancient and hilly city, known for its annual Viljandi Folk Music Festival, beautiful old town and overwhelming and picturesque park around the old castle.

destinations.title: Kuressaare
destinations.description: – The capital of the island of Saaremaa, the only town on the island, and home of the Kuressaare castle. It also has many spas, water parks and one beach.

destinations.title: Valga
destinations.description: – A town on the border with Latvia, where it literally grows into the Latvian town of Valka.

destinations.title: Lahemaa National Park
destinations.description: – On the coast within an hour east (50 km) of Tallinn. Given its size it is the largest park in Estonia and one of Europe's biggest national parks, with 1,000 km2 of bogs, trails, and forests.

destinations.title: Soomaa National Park
destinations.description: – The second largest national park in Estonia, famous for its "fifth season". A peat bog formed from a glacier melt from around 11,000 years ago.

destinations.title: Matsalu National Park
destinations.description: – One of the largest and most important autumn stopping grounds for migratory birds in Europe. Excellent for birdwatchers, due it is rich ornithological species.

destinations.title: Vilsandi National Park
destinations.description: – Rich in marine fauna, and international bird sanctuary with over 250 recorded bird species, on the west coast of Saaremaa. Covers 238 km2, including 163 km2 of sea and 75 km2 of land, plus 160 islands and islets.

destinations.title: Karula National Park
destinations.description: – The hilly landscapes of Southern Estonia. Estonian’s smallest national park between Valga and Võru.

destinations.title: South Estonia
destinations.description: – A 5 km hike and wooden trail with an observation platform in the middle of the swamps.

destinations.title: Otepää
destinations.description: – Part of the Otepää recreational region with an area beyond 3,000 km². Trails along the lake and paths in the hilly forests.

destinations.title: Saaremaa
destinations.description: – The largest Estonian and wild seaside character island with castles and fortresses, one perfectly preserved, a beach, a spa and famous mills. Saaremaa is even sometimes called Sparemaa. Furthermore, the island is surrounded by a myriad of tiny islands including Abruka with its nudist camps.

destinations.title: Hiiumaa
destinations.description: – The second largest Estonian island. Popular for its lighthouses, ancient churches, historical values and the sense of humour of its inhabitants, but scarcely populated. In winter, it can sometimes be reached by car via an ice bridge on the Baltic Sea.

destinations.title: Kihnu
destinations.description: – The southernmost group of islands, Khinu, is on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Cosy and warm yet exotic – folk costumes are worn here every day and the handicraft of older generations remains highly valued.

destinations.title: Muhu
destinations.description: – The third largest Estonian island, and a rural municipality connected to the nearby Saaremaa by an artificial embankment, where ferries to the harbour of Virtsu arrive. Has an open air museum, and its locals are known for still sewing woollen clothes. Sleepy fishing villages, working windmills, thatched cottages, plenty of deer, moose and birds.

destinations.title: Ruhnu
destinations.description: – The communal territory corresponds to that of the homonymous island, formerly known as Runö.

destinations.title: Vormsi
destinations.description: – The fourth largest Estonian island, very close to the mainland. Vormsi is a small island covered with forests and a Swedish community. A unique blend of Soviet and Swedish history mixed with unspoilt nature.

France.title: France
France.summary: France, officially the French Republic (French: République française), is a country with which almost every traveller has a relationship. Many dream of its joie de vivre shown by the countless cafés, picturesque villages and world-famous gastronomy. Some come to follow the trail of France's great philosophers, writers and artists, or to immerse in the beautiful language it gave the world. And others still are drawn to the country's geographical diversity, with its long coastlines, massive mountain ranges and breathtaking farmland vistas.

Gambia.title: Gambia
Gambia.summary: The Gambia is a country in West Africa and is the smallest country on the continent of Africa. It has a short North Atlantic Ocean coastline in the west and is surrounded by Senegal so that it is almost an enclave. The country occupies the navigable length of the Gambia River valley and surrounding hills.

Georgia (country).title: Georgia (country)
Georgia (country).summary: Georgia (Georgian: საქართველო, Sakartvelo) is a country in the Caucasus. Sandwiched between Russia in the north and Turkey in the south, it sits along the coast of the Black Sea. It is a rather mountainous country and is home to some of Europe’s highest mountain peaks. Despite its modest size, Georgia presents a large mix of other landscapes and micro-climates, ranging from dry wine-growing valleys in the east, to lush Black Sea resorts in the west. In Greek mythology, Georgia was the site of the famous Golden Fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts. The tales of Georgia's ancient history are not without foundation; modern archaeological evidence suggests that Georgia is the oldest winemaking country in the world, with some wine samples dating back to 6,000 years BC. In testament to this rich heritage, Georgia's cities and countryside are complete with medieval churches, several of which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Enjoying low levels of crime and corruption, since the mid-2000s Georgia has developed into a fast-growing destination. The country's tourist infrastructure continues to expand.

Despite its modest size, Georgia presents a large mix of other landscapes and micro-climates, ranging from dry wine-growing valleys in the east, to lush Black Sea resorts in the west. In Greek mythology, Georgia was the site of the famous Golden Fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts. The tales of Georgia's ancient history are not without foundation; modern archaeological evidence suggests that Georgia is the oldest winemaking country in the world, with some wine samples dating back to 6,000 years BC. In testament to this rich heritage, Georgia's cities and countryside are complete with medieval churches, several of which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Enjoying low levels of crime and corruption, since the mid-2000s Georgia has developed into a fast-growing destination. The country's tourist infrastructure continues to expand.

destinations.description: – The most cosmopolitan and diverse of Georgia's cities, Tbilisi is not just the nation's capital but also a hub that contains nearly a third of all of Georgia's population. It is an interesting mix of old classical and ultra modern buildings.

destinations.title: Borjomi

destinations.title: Gori

destinations.title: Sighnaghi

destinations.title: Telavi

destinations.title: Kakheti

destinations.title: Kazbegi
destinations.description: – of the highest mountains in Europe is also home to Holy Trinity church, perched on top of a hill overlooking a ravine.

destinations.title: David Gareja Monastery Complex

destinations.title: Pasanauri

destinations.title: Shatili
destinations.description: – A high mountainous village near the border with Russia. Located in the deep Arghuni gorge at approximate 1,400 m, the village is a unique complex of medieval-to-early modern fortresses and fortified dwellings of stone and mortar.

destinations.title: Mazeri

destinations.title: Vardzia

destinations.title: Gori
destinations.description: – A 3,600 year old Silk Road cave city that was a major regional centre of pagan religions.

Germany.title: Germany
Germany.summary: Germany (German: Deutschland), officially the Federal Republic of Germany (Bundesrepublik Deutschland) is the largest country in Central Europe and the most populous EU state.  It's bordered to the east by the Czech Republic and Poland, to the north by Denmark, to the west by Belgium, Luxembourg, the Netherlands and France and to the south by Austria and Switzerland. Germany is subdivided into 16 politically powerful states that sometimes correspond to historic regions predating a unified German state, while they sometimes randomly throw vastly different peoples into the same state while separating them from their more similar kin across state lines.

Germany is subdivided into 16 politically powerful states that sometimes correspond to historic regions predating a unified German state, while they sometimes randomly throw vastly different peoples into the same state while separating them from their more similar kin across state lines.

sights.title: Königssee

sights.title: Nürburgring
sights.description: race track in Nürburg, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany

destinations.title: Berlin
destinations.description: – The reunified and reinvigorated capital of Germany; known for its being divided during the Cold War by the Berlin Wall. Today a metropolis of diversity with some of the world's best clubs, shops, galleries and restaurants. Due to its long status as a divided city, Berlin also boasts more operas and museums per capita than most other places in the world. The suburb of Potsdam with its Royal-Prussian palaces and gardens shouldn't be missed when in Berlin.

destinations.title: Bremen
destinations.description: – its old market, the Schnoor, the Böttcherstrasse, the Viertel and the maritime flair of Bremen and its harbor Bremerhaven (which together form the Bundesland of Bremen, the smallest Land in both size and population) are a great urban experience.

destinations.title: Cologne
destinations.description: (Köln) – founded by the Romans 2000 years ago and known for its huge cathedral (second largest in the world), Romanesque churches, archaeological sites and the lively old town quarter. The Cologne Carnival is a major draw around February.

destinations.title: Dresden
destinations.description: – Once called Elbflorenz ('Florence on the Elbe'), the Frauenkirche (the finest baroque Cathedral outside Italy, destroyed during the war and rebuilt from 1994 to 2005) and its rebuilt historic Altstadt that was also destroyed during the war. The Zwinger and Residenzschloss museums are unmatched in the world.

destinations.title: Düsseldorf
destinations.description: – Germany's capital of shopping that also has a wide variety of fascinating new architecture. The "Altstadt" quarter and the Rhine embankments have a vibrant nightlife.

destinations.title: Frankfurt
destinations.description: – magnificent skyline, financial and transportation hub of Europe, headquarters of the European Central Bank (ECB) and an important trade fair. Small reconstructed centre with half-timbered houses, important museums and galleries around the Museumsufer like the Schirn Art Hall, the Städel and the Senckenberg Natural Museum.

destinations.title: Hamburg
destinations.description: – Germany's second-largest city, with a metropolitan character second only to that of Berlin, famous for its harbour as well as its liberal culture. Don't miss the bustling nightlife around St. Pauli with the Reeperbahn and its night clubs and entertainment venues. Historically one of the cities of the Hanseatic League and a leading trade center after that, it remains one of three German "city states" i.e. a city that is its own Bundesland.

destinations.title: Munich
destinations.description: (München) –  Germany's third-largest city and booming capital of Bavaria is known for the Oktoberfest, the Hofbräuhaus, its manifold cultural offerings including operas, theaters and museums, a vibrant nightlife, many music festivals, its beer gardens and river surfing, and is the gateway to the Alps.

destinations.title: Nuremberg
destinations.description: (Nürnberg) – a former Reichsstadt with a medieval touch, its old town was partly reconstructed after severe bombing in World War II, including the Gothic Kaiserburg and the major churches, and you can also visit the Nazi party rally grounds, the Documentation Center and Courtroom 600 (the venue of the Nuremberg war crime trials).

destinations.title: Baltic Sea Coast (Germany)
destinations.description: (Ostseeküste) – once the playground for crowned heads, this region is coming into its own again after the Cold War shut much of it off from the wider world. Site of the famous Strandkorb picture of the 2007 G8 summit.

destinations.title: Bavarian Alps
destinations.description: (Bayerische Alpen) – Germany perhaps at its most clichéd, but also its most beautiful; nice skiing in winter, hiking in summer and Schloss Neuschwanstein are just the most obvious attractions

destinations.title: Black Forest
destinations.description: (Schwarzwald) – You are likely to think "cuckoo clock" or cherry pie, and you'd be forgiven, but there is much more to this region than that

destinations.title: East Frisian Islands
destinations.description: (Ostfriesische Inseln) – among Germany's most popular summer holiday spots, those largely car free islands in the Wadden Sea still see less international visitors than they deserve

destinations.title: Franconian Switzerland
destinations.description: (Fränkische Schweiz) – a favorite with early 19th century poets who gave a name that stuck, this karst region is world renowned for its climbing and has some beautiful caves

destinations.title: Harz
destinations.description: – long forgotten due to German partition running right through it, the Harz is today attracting tourists with superb hiking and the mystic romanticism of the Brocken mountain that is reputed to attract witches (as mentioned in Goethe's Faust)

destinations.title: Lake Constance
destinations.description: (Bodensee) – Germany's largest lake, the "Swabian Ocean" (as it is jokingly) offers alpine panorama and water activities at the same time

destinations.title: Middle Rhine Valley
destinations.description: (Mittelrheintal) – part of the Rhine River is a UNESCO Heritage Site between Bingen/Rüdesheim and Koblenz; the valley is famous for its wines

destinations.title: North Frisian Islands
destinations.description: (Nordfriesische Inseln) - calm islands with resorts at the North Sea coast, especially Sylt is known for its posh celebrity guests and the pristine landscape

destinations.title: Prague
destinations.description: in the Czech Republic and Warsaw in Poland

destinations.title: France
destinations.description: cities of Reims and Paris as well as the country and town of Luxembourg would make good first goals.

destinations.title: Strasbourg
destinations.description: a lovely town at the border with French and German influence alike

destinations.title: Austria
destinations.description: and Switzerland with Salzburg  and Lausanne being "must visit" places.

destinations.title: Cruising the Baltic Sea
destinations.description: to access the Baltic states and Nordic Countries.

Ghana.title: Ghana
Ghana.summary: Ghana is a country in West Africa. It borders the countries of Côte d'Ivoire to the west, Burkina Faso to the north and Togo to the east and the Atlantic Ocean Gulf of Guinea to the south.
Ghana.description: Ghana is a country in West Africa. It borders the countries of Côte d'Ivoire to the west, Burkina Faso to the north and Togo to the east and the Atlantic Ocean Gulf of Guinea to the south.

destinations.title: Kakum National Park
destinations.description: rainforest area with a long canopy walk, delightful to be above the treetops, but rare to see any wildlife except birds.  Monkeys as well as elephants and antelope are said to live in the region. There is a good little museum and a café at the park entrance.

destinations.title: Mole National Park
destinations.description: savannah with buffalo, monkeys, antelope, and reintroduced lions & elephants; both driving and walking safaris are popular, you can even camp for the night on the savannah.

destinations.title: Paga
destinations.description: a town in the north home to "sacred crocodiles" which are tame and live in Paga Crocodile Pond.

destinations.title: Shai Hills Reserve
destinations.description: a great day trip near Accra home to baboons, parrots, & antelope; you can tour the reserve on horseback.

destinations.title: Wli Falls
destinations.description: in the lush Agumatsa Wildlife Sanctuary near the Togo border.

Greece.title: Greece
Greece.summary: Greece (Greek: Ελλάς, Hellas or Ελλάδα, Ellada) is a country in southeastern Europe, on the southern tip of the Balkan peninsula. Ancient Greece was one of Europe's first urban civilizations, and the origin of much of the arts, language, philosophy, politics, and sports of western society. The cultural heritage and spectacular mountains and beaches draw tourists from far away.

Grenada.title: Grenada
Grenada.summary: Grenada (pronounced grih-NAY-duh) is a group of three larger islands (Grenada, Carriacou, and Petite Martinique) and several tiny islands in the Caribbean, or West Indies. It lies just north of Trinidad and Tobago, and southwest of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. It is famous for spices and is known as the "Spice Isle", being a major source of nutmeg, cloves, ginger, cinnamon, vanilla and cocoa.
Grenada.description: Grenada (pronounced grih-NAY-duh) is a group of three larger islands (Grenada, Carriacou, and Petite Martinique) and several tiny islands in the Caribbean, or West Indies. It lies just north of Trinidad and Tobago, and southwest of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. It is famous for spices and is known as the "Spice Isle", being a major source of nutmeg, cloves, ginger, cinnamon, vanilla and cocoa.

Guatemala.title: Guatemala
Guatemala.summary: Guatemala is a country in Central America. It has borders to Mexico in the north/northwest, to Belize in the northeast, to Honduras in the southeast, to El Salvador in the south. It has a Pacific coastline to the southwest, and a tiny piece of Caribbean coastline to the east. Guatemala is very tough land. You can experience volcanic activity, seismic activity (earthquakes, mudslides), and hurricanes.
Guatemala.description: Guatemala is a country in Central America. It has borders to Mexico in the north/northwest, to Belize in the northeast, to Honduras in the southeast, to El Salvador in the south. It has a Pacific coastline to the southwest, and a tiny piece of Caribbean coastline to the east. Guatemala is very tough land. You can experience volcanic activity, seismic activity (earthquakes, mudslides), and hurricanes.

destinations.title: Lake Atitlán
destinations.description: Beautiful lake region in the mountains surrounded by many picturesque villages and volcanoes, which is becoming more and more touristic

destinations.title: Semuc Champey
destinations.description: It consists of a natural 300 m limestone bridge, under which passes the Cahabón River. Atop the bridge is a series of stepped, turquoise pools, a popular swimming attraction.

destinations.title: Monterrico
destinations.description: The beach closest to Guatemala City and Antigua, volcanic sand.

destinations.title: Rio Dulce
destinations.description: Known as "a ‘one of a kind’ ecological and cultural heritage for humanity", and home of one of the largest bridges in Central America, the area surrounding this emerald "Sweet River" has many sites to see and things to do. From jungle hikes to the Hot Springs Waterfalls (Rio Dulce is home to Finca Paraiso), visiting Castillo San Felipe de Lara, sailing & watersports, seeing the colorful, friendly surrounding villages & landscapes to taking a Lancha tour through the Majestic Canyon from Livingston. There are plenty of places to stay, including some sweet spots right on the water. Rio Dulce is also a huge hub of access to not only places within Guatemala, such as Antigua, Tikal, Cobán, Semuc Champey and more, but is equally a point of access to the surrounding countries of Belize, Mexico, Honduras, Nicaragua, and El Salvador.

destinations.title: El Mirador
destinations.description: massive early Maya site, perhaps the cradle of Maya civilization. Still being uncovered and studied; less developed for visitors than the other largest Maya sites.

destinations.title: Tikal
destinations.description: long considered the largest of Maya ruins (although the ongoing investigations of El Mirador may challenge this claim), this huge and impressive ancient Maya site is probably worth the trip to Guatemala by itself. Stay in the park or in nearby Flores the night before in order to organise an early morning trip to Tikal, to see the sun rise over the ruins. Tours are easily organised from the surrounding areas.

destinations.title: Aguateca
destinations.description: some of the best-preserved Mayan ruins in Guatemala where you are more likely to encounter archaeologists at work than tourists with cameras

destinations.title: El Peru
destinations.description: (Waká) — a three day trek/boat trip from Flores and identified as the source of many looted Maya artifacts

destinations.title: Iximche
destinations.description: ruins in the Central Highlands, an easy day trip from Guatemala City or Antigua.

destinations.title: Nakúm
destinations.description: an impressive Classic Maya site

destinations.title: Yaxhá
destinations.description: ruins with more than 500 structures, between Flores and Melchor de Mencos

Guinea.title: Guinea
Guinea.summary: Guinea (officially the Republic of Guinea; French: République de Guinée) is a former French colony that borders Guinea-Bissau and Senegal to the north, Mali on the north and north-east, Côte d'Ivoire to the east and Liberia and Sierra Leone to the south. Unrest in Sierra Leone has spilled across the border, creating humanitarian emergencies and threatening the stability of this country. The country is often sometimes called Guinea-Conakry to distinguish it from Guinea-Bissau and Equatorial Guinea.
Guinea.description: Guinea (officially the Republic of Guinea; French: République de Guinée) is a former French colony that borders Guinea-Bissau and Senegal to the north, Mali on the north and north-east, Côte d'Ivoire to the east and Liberia and Sierra Leone to the south. Unrest in Sierra Leone has spilled across the border, creating humanitarian emergencies and threatening the stability of this country. The country is often sometimes called Guinea-Conakry to distinguish it from Guinea-Bissau and Equatorial Guinea.

destinations.title: Bafatá
destinations.description: Bafata is a pleasant town with an interesting colonial centre, located on the Rio Gêba. Hometown of Bissau-Guinean patriot Amilcar Cabral. Ask around near the old market to visit his house.

destinations.title: Bolama
destinations.description: capital of the country until 1941, has some magnificent examples of colonial architecture and has been suggested as a world heritage site.

destinations.title: Buba
destinations.description: End of the tarmac going to the south of Guinea-Bissau. The town is built along a tidal river, the Rio Grande de Buba. Decent hotel.

destinations.title: Bubaque
destinations.description: Largest town in the Bijagos archipelago, with hotels and harbor for boat trips to other islands.

destinations.title: Cacheu
destinations.description: Cacheu was once an important place for slave-trading, and there is still a little fort.

destinations.title: Gabú
destinations.description: Busy market town, with a predominantly Muslim population.

destinations.title: Bijagos Islands
destinations.description: an archipelago of some twenty tropical, beautiful islands. On the island of Orango it is possible to see hippos, and there are many other possibilities of eco tourism on the "unspoiled islands". On some islands there are even turtle nesting grounds. Many islands have French-owned fishing lodges.

destinations.title: Varela
destinations.description: Just south of Cap Skirring, but on the Guinea-Bissau side of the border, it is a tour de force to get to Varela on a 50 km long bumpy dirt road from São Domingos - but it is all rewarded when you reach this little paradise, with a superb Italian-owned hotel, beautiful beaches and pine forests and a very relaxed atmosphere with almost no other tourists.

Guyana.title: Guyana
Guyana.summary: The country of Guyana is in north-eastern South America. It has an Atlantic Ocean coastline in the northeast, and lies between Suriname to the east and Venezuela to the west, with Brazil to the south.
Guyana.description: The country of Guyana is in north-eastern South America. It has an Atlantic Ocean coastline in the northeast, and lies between Suriname to the east and Venezuela to the west, with Brazil to the south.

destinations.title: Brazil
destinations.description: Access to Brazil is via Lethem. There are Interserv buses - get the schedule at the Interserv Bus Office on Charlotte Street in central Georgetown. Typically, the buses leave late at night. Another option are minibuses that ply the Georgetown-Lethem road, although the lack of paved road beyond Linden means that the trip will probably need to be broken up overnight.

destinations.title: Suriname

destinations.title: Venezuela
destinations.description: Your best options would be to travel overland via Brazil or fly via Curaçao or Aruba.

Haiti.title: Haiti
Haiti.summary: Haiti (Haitian Creole: Ayiti, French: Haïti) is a Caribbean country that occupies the western three-eighths of the island of Hispaniola. The eastern five-eighths of Hispaniola is occupied by the Dominican Republic. The North Atlantic Ocean lies to the north, while the Caribbean Sea lies to the south. Haiti is a country with a troubled past, and its future still remains uncertain. Decades of poverty, environmental degradation, violence, instability, dictatorship and coups, and a devastating earthquake, among other things, have left it the poorest nation in the western hemisphere.
Haiti.description: Haiti (Haitian Creole: Ayiti, French: Haïti) is a Caribbean country that occupies the western three-eighths of the island of Hispaniola. The eastern five-eighths of Hispaniola is occupied by the Dominican Republic. The North Atlantic Ocean lies to the north, while the Caribbean Sea lies to the south. destinations.title: Cap-Haïtien

destinations.title: Gonaïves
destinations.description: here, on 1 January 1804, Jean-Jacques Dessalines signed Haiti's Act of Independence, establishing the world's first black republic.

destinations.title: Jacmel
destinations.description: a relaxed town with a beautiful historic center and a claim not easily dismissed to be the country's artistic and cultural capital, albeit in ruins following the earthquake.

destinations.title: Jérémie
destinations.description: Haiti's westernmost and profoundly isolated town is a sleepy little charming place.

destinations.title: Les Cayes

destinations.title: Petionville
destinations.description: a wealthy and much safer suburb of Port-au-Prince, where you will find most of the capital's nightlife, restaurants, wealthy Haitians, and foreigners.

destinations.title: Port-de-Paix
destinations.description: the main city in Haiti's drug-smuggling coast, with the opportunity to hail a ferry to Tortuga Island, a virtually undiscovered tropical paradise—albeit well discovered through the centuries by any famous pirate worth his salt and not a few wealthy drug lords.

destinations.title: Port-Salut
destinations.description: President Aristide's birthplace, home to miles of gorgeous, empty white sand beaches.

destinations.title: Labadie
destinations.description: a private port used by cruise ships.

Honduras.title: Honduras
Honduras.summary: Honduras is the second-biggest country in Central America. It has colonial villages (Gracias, Comayagua), ancient Maya ruins (Copán), natural parks (Moskitia), and a Pacific and Caribbean coastline and the Bay Islands, with great beaches and coral reefs where snorkeling and diving are exceptional by any standard.
Honduras.description: Honduras is the second-biggest country in Central America. It has colonial villages (Gracias, Comayagua), ancient Maya ruins (Copán), natural parks (Moskitia), and a Pacific and Caribbean coastline and the Bay Islands, with great beaches and coral reefs where snorkeling and diving are exceptional by any standard.

destinations.title: Tegucigalpa
destinations.description: the capital and largest city of Honduras with an international airport.

destinations.title: La Ceiba
destinations.description: port city on Caribbean coast with great beaches and daily ferries to the Bay Islands.

destinations.title: El Progreso
destinations.description: located at a strategic crossroads where major highways towards Comayagua, San Pedro Sula and Tela all converge.

destinations.title: Comayagua
destinations.description: the former capital of the country is today a quiet colonial town with a beautiful cathedral, notable Spanish architecture and an historic town center.

destinations.title: Gracias
destinations.description: a pleasant colonial mountain town; nearby Parque Celaque is home to the highest mountain in Honduras set among wonderful cloud forests.

destinations.title: Puerto Cortes
destinations.description: the main harbour town on the Caribbean coast.

destinations.title: San Pedro Sula
destinations.description: located in the Sula Valley in the northwest corner of the country, this is a major transportation and economic hub.

destinations.title: Santa Rosa de Copán
destinations.description: temperate mountain city in the western part of the region, and the nearest place of any size to Copán.

destinations.title: Tela
destinations.description: an old city with a beautiful sandy coastline and is also home to the second largest humid tropical botanical garden for commercial plants in the world.

destinations.title: Bay Islands
destinations.description: Utila, Roatán, Guanaja, and the Hog Islands are a natural Caribbean paradise very popular for snorkeling and diving.

destinations.title: Copán Ruinas
destinations.description: one of the most impressive ruins of the Maya civilization, known for the quality of its sculpture.

destinations.title: Lake Yojoa
destinations.description: the biggest lake in Honduras which  is famous for its fried fish. Nearby are two national parks that hold pristine rainforest and cloud forest as well as Honduras's first microbrewery.

destinations.title: Río Plátano Biosphere Reserve
destinations.description: the largest tropical rainforest in Central America.

destinations.title: San Pedro Sula
destinations.description: One of Honduras' most exotic destinations, Leaving from  by a 4x4 trail into the dense cloud forest.

Hungary.title: Hungary
Hungary.summary: Hungary (Hungarian: Magyarország) is an EU member state featuring a gorgeous capital city, Budapest, and the largest lake in Central Europe, Balaton. Hungary offers many diverse destinations: relatively low mountains in the north-west, the Great Plain in the east, lakes and rivers of all sorts, and many beautiful small villages and hidden gems of cities. Top this off with Hungary's great accessibility in the middle of Europe, a vivid culture and economy, and you get a destination absolutely worth visiting if you're in the region.

Iceland.title: Iceland
Iceland.summary: Iceland (Icelandic: Ísland) is an island nation in the north Atlantic Ocean. Iceland is one of the Nordic countries, and therefore culturally part of Europe. The name Iceland is a misnomer: while glaciers cover 10% of the land, climate is mild, and volcanic activity keeps the country warm. Settled during the Viking Age, Iceland has the world's oldest surviving parliament, the Alþingi. It is known as the Land of Fire and Ice.
Iceland.description: Iceland (Icelandic: Ísland) is an island nation in the north Atlantic Ocean. Iceland is one of the Nordic countries, and therefore culturally part of Europe. The name Iceland is a misnomer: while glaciers cover 10% of the land, climate is mild, and volcanic activity keeps the country warm. Settled during the Viking Age, Iceland has the world's oldest surviving parliament, the Alþingi. It is known as the Land of Fire and Ice.

sights.title: Vatnajökull
sights.description: largest and most voluminous Icelandic glacier

destinations.title: Reykjavík
destinations.description: (REYG-ya-veeg) — The capital of Iceland and the largest city

destinations.title: Akureyri
destinations.description: (Ahk-oo-rey-rih) — Capital of the North and the largest town outside the Southwest

destinations.title: Egilsstaðir
destinations.description: (AY-yill-stath-ihr) — Main town in the East, has some of the best weather Iceland has to offer

destinations.title: Hafnarfjörður
destinations.description: (HAP-nar-FYERTH-er)  — Cozy town on the outskirts of the capital region

destinations.title: Höfn
destinations.description: (HEP'n) — Main town on the southeastern coast

destinations.title: Húsavík
destinations.description: (HOOS-ah-veek) — One of the world's most reliable whale watching sites during the summer

destinations.title: Ísafjörður
destinations.description: (EES-ah-FYERTH-er) — Largest town of the Westfjords of Iceland

destinations.title: Selfoss
destinations.description: (SEL-fos) — South Iceland's largest town, hub of the main agricultural region

destinations.title: Stykkishólmur
destinations.description: (STICK-is-hole-mur) — Main town on the Snæfellsnes peninsula, gateway to the islands of Breiðafjörður

destinations.title: Reykjavík
destinations.description: capital and largest city in Iceland

destinations.title: Akureyri
destinations.description: town in Iceland

destinations.title: Þingvellir National Park
destinations.description: (pronounced "THING-vet-lihr") - National Park and a UNESCO World Heritage site. 30 to 50 kilometres (19 to 31 mi) east of Reykjavík. Interesting for a number of reasons: it is the original site of the longest running parliament in the world (the name literally means 'parliamentary fields'), and it's where the North-American and European continental shelf plates are being torn apart.

destinations.title: Vatnajökull National Park
destinations.description: (VAT-nah-yer-CUDDLE) - Iceland's newest national park was founded in 2008 and includes the former Skaftafell and Jokulsargljufur National Parks. Vatnajökull National Park is Europe's largest national park at 12,000 square kilometres (4,600 sq mi), covering about 12% of the surface of Iceland. The park is home to Iceland's highest mountain, Hvannadalshnúkur, largest glacier, Vatnajökull, and Europe's largest waterfall in terms of volume discharge, Dettifoss.

destinations.title: Snæfellsjökull National Park
destinations.description: (SNY-fetls-yer-CUDDLE) - Located on the tip of the Snæfellsnes Peninsula in western Iceland, this park is home to the ice-covered volcanic crater that was the setting for Jules Verne's book Journey to the Center of the Earth.

destinations.title: Blue Lagoon
destinations.description: (Icelandic: Bláa Lónið) (BLAU-ah LONE-eeth) Famous outdoor pool and health centre. The spa is in Grindavík on the Reykjanes Peninsula, south-western Iceland. It is situated approximately 13 km (8 mi) from the Keflavík International Airport and 39 km (24 mi) from Reykjavík. This geothermal spa in the middle of a lava field with its milky blue water is quite surreal.

destinations.title: Mývatn
destinations.description: (MEE-fatn) - A lake region near Akureyri in the North of Iceland, Mývatn has an unearthly appearance owing to special types of volcanic craters throughout the lake. There are plenty of activities in this area: Smajfall (desert where sulphuric steam comes out of the ground) and Dimmuborgir (aka the Black City and the Gates of Hell).

destinations.title: Gullfoss
destinations.description: The Golden Falls. On the edge of the inhospitable Interior of Iceland about 100 km east of Reykjavík, the river Hvítá plunges down a double cascade to create what many people believe is the most beautiful waterfall in Iceland

destinations.title: Geysir
destinations.description: Geothermal hot spot located 10 km west of Gullfoss. Geysir itself (from which the English word "geyser" derives) is no longer reliably active, but fortunately Strokkur next door goes off every five to ten minutes.

destinations.title: Jökulsárlón
destinations.description: (the Jökulsár Lagoon) - The majestic glacial lagoon in southeast Iceland located near Höfn on Route 1. Breiðamerkurjökull glacier retreated quickly from 1920 to 1965 leaving this breathtaking lagoon, which is up to 190 m deep. Ice breaks off from the glacier keeping the lagoon stocked with icebergs all year round. The James Bond film Die Another Day was filmed here in 2002.

destinations.title: Landmannalaugar
destinations.description: A region of outstanding natural beauty reachable by bus (or 4x4) from Reykjavík. Situated in the Interior, it gives a taste of the uninhabited highlands at Iceland’s core.

destinations.title: Þórsmörk
destinations.description: (Thor's Mark) - Tucked away between three glaciers, Þórsmörk is an incredibly beautiful and relatively isolated area. Icelanders enjoy camping there in the summer. There are many hiking trails all over the area, which provide breathtaking views of the surrounding glaciers and lava formations. It is accessible only by truck or bus: it is a good idea to inquire about trips to Þórsmörk at a tourist information center.

India.title: India
India.summary: India (Hindi: भारत or Bharat) is the largest country in the Indian subcontinent and shares borders with Pakistan to the northwest, China and Nepal to the north, Bhutan to the northeast, and Bangladesh and Myanmar to the east. Nearby island countries in the Indian Ocean are Sri Lanka to the southeast and the Maldives to the southwest.
India.description: India (Hindi: भारत or Bharat) is the largest country in the Indian subcontinent and shares borders with Pakistan to the northwest, China and Nepal to the north, Bhutan to the northeast, and Bangladesh and Myanmar to the east. Nearby island countries in the Indian Ocean are Sri Lanka to the southeast and the Maldives to the southwest.

Indonesia.title: Indonesia
Indonesia.summary: Indonesia is a huge archipelago of diverse islands scattered over both sides of the Equator between the Indian Ocean and the Pacific Ocean. With more than 260 million people, Indonesia is the fourth most populous country in the world — after China, India and the USA — and by far the largest in Southeast Asia. While it has land borders with Malaysia to the north and East Timor and Papua New Guinea to the east, its exclusive economic zone also abuts Australia to the south; Palau, the Philippines, Vietnam, Singapore, and Thailand to the north; and India to the northwest. With an extensive, but quickly carved out amount of green forests on all of its islands and half way between the poles, Indonesia is nicknamed The Emerald of the Equator.
Indonesia.description: Indonesia is a huge archipelago of diverse islands scattered over both sides of the Equator between the Indian Ocean and the Pacific Ocean. With more than 260 million people, Indonesia is the fourth most populous country in the world — after China, India and the USA — and by far the largest in Southeast Asia. While it has land borders with Malaysia to the north and East Timor and Papua New Guinea to the east, its exclusive economic zone also abuts Australia to the south; Palau, the Philippines, Vietnam, Singapore, and Thailand to the north; and India to the northwest. With an extensive, but quickly carved out amount of green forests on all of its islands and half way between the poles, Indonesia is nicknamed The Emerald of the Equator.

destinations.title: Baliem Valley

Iran.title: Iran
Iran.summary: Iran (Persian: ایران) is a large country between the Gulf of Oman, the Persian Gulf, and the Caspian Sea. It was renamed Iran in the early 20th century; before that it was known as Persia. It is bordered by Iraq to the west, Turkey, Azerbaijan's Nakhchivan enclave, Armenia, and Azerbaijan to the northwest, Turkmenistan to the northeast,  and Afghanistan and Pakistan to the east.
Iran.description: Iran (Persian: ایران) is a large country between the Gulf of Oman, the Persian Gulf, and the Caspian Sea. It was renamed Iran in the early 20th century; before that it was known as Persia. It is bordered by Iraq to the west, Turkey, Azerbaijan's Nakhchivan enclave, Armenia, and Azerbaijan to the northwest, Turkmenistan to the northeast,  and Afghanistan and Pakistan to the east.

sights.title: Chogha Zanbil
sights.description: elamite complex in the Khuzestan province of Iran

sights.title: Mashhad
sights.description: capital city of Razavi Khorasan Province, and second largest city in Iran

sights.title: Naqsh-e Jahan Square
sights.description: Historical square at the center of Isfahan city, Iran

destinations.title: Tehran
destinations.description: (Persian: تهران) – the vibrant capital, a beautiful city that suffers horrendous traffic and air pollution

destinations.title: Hamedan
destinations.description: (Persian: همدان) – one of the oldest cities in Iran

destinations.title: Isfahan
destinations.description: (Persian: اصفهان‎) – a former capital with stunning architecture, great bazaar, and tree-lined boulevards. Most popular tourist destination in the country. There's a Persian saying that "Isfahan is half the world."

destinations.title: Kerman
destinations.description: (Persian: کرمان) – this south-eastern city is one of the five historical cities of Iran.

destinations.title: Mashad
destinations.description: (Persian: مشهد‎‎) – the greatest city of eastern Iran, with an important mosque, the shrine of the Imam Reza

destinations.title: Qom
destinations.description: (Persian: قم‎‎) – one of the holiest cities in the Middle East, considered the Jewel of Iran

destinations.title: Shiraz
destinations.description: (Persian: شیراز) – a former capital, home of famous Persian poets such as Hafiz and Sa'di; known for gardens, especially roses. Very close to the famous ruins of Persepolis.

destinations.title: Tabriz
destinations.description: (Persian: تبریز) – a former capital with a great historical bazaar, now a provincial capital in western Iran; it's been suggested that this is the site of the Biblical "Garden of Eden"

destinations.title: Yazd
destinations.description: (Persian: یزد‎‎) – a remote desert city – circumstance influenced special architectural themes where water streams run in underground rooms in houses and wind-towers to keep them cool.

destinations.title: Alamut
destinations.description: (Persian: الموت‎‎), near Qazvin  –  castle of the legendary Assassins.

destinations.title: Dizin
destinations.description: (Persian: دیزین) – one of the highest ski resorts in the world, two hours north of Tehran. Great powder snow, cheap prices and few international visitors makes this is a great place for a ski holiday.

destinations.title: Kish Island
destinations.description: (Persian: کیش‎‎) – a free trade zone in the Persian Gulf, it is regarded as a consumer's 'paradise', with numerous malls, shopping centres, tourist attractions, and resort hotels. There is also Iran's first marina on the east side of the island.

destinations.title: Qeshm Island
destinations.description: (Persian: قشم) – Iran's largest and the Persian Gulf's largest island. Qeshm island is famous for its wide range of ecotourist attractions such as the Hara marine forests. According to environmentalists, about 1.5% of the world birds and 25% of Iran's native birds annually migrate to Hara forests which is the first national geo park.

destinations.title: Pasargad
destinations.description: (Persian: پاسارگاد) – the first capital of the Achaemenid Empire, and home to the tomb of Cyrus the Great.

destinations.title: Persepolis
destinations.description: – impressive ruins of a vast city-like complex built over 2,500 years ago, near the modern city of Shiraz. It was set on fire by Alexander of Macedon and further ruined by Arabs. Called TakhteJamshid in Persian, Persepolis is the symbol of Iranian nationality.

destinations.title: Shush (Iran)
destinations.description: (or Shush) (Persian: شوش‎‎) – 200 km north of Ahvaz, was Iran's most ancient city. The Ziggurat of Chughazanbil, Darius the Great's palace, the Jewish prophet Daniel's temple and Artaxerxer II 's palace are among the historical sites.

Iraq.title: Iraq
Iraq.summary: Iraq (Arabic: العراق Al-Irāq) is a republic in the Middle East, north-west of the Persian Gulf. It borders Iran to the east, Kuwait to the south, Saudi Arabia to the southwest, Jordan to the west, Syria to the northwest, and Turkey to the north.
Iraq.description: Iraq (Arabic: العراق Al-Irāq) is a republic in the Middle East, north-west of the Persian Gulf. It borders Iran to the east, Kuwait to the south, Saudi Arabia to the southwest, Jordan to the west, Syria to the northwest, and Turkey to the north.

sights.title: Middle East
sights.description: region that encompasses majority of Western Asia and Egypt

sights.title: Kufa
sights.description: city in Iraq, about 170 kilometres (110 mi) south of Baghdad, and 10 kilometres (6.2 mi) northeast of Najaf.

destinations.title: Baghdad
destinations.description: (بغداد) — capital of Iraq.

destinations.title: Ar Rutba
destinations.description: (الرطبة) — most isolated town in Iraq, deep in the desert.

destinations.title: Basra
destinations.description: (البَصرة) — large port city with extremely hot climate.

destinations.title: Dahuk (city)
destinations.description: (دهوك) — Kurdish city surrounded by mountains.

destinations.title: Erbil
destinations.description: (Arbil) (أربيل) — capital of Iraqi Kurdistan.

destinations.title: Fallujah
destinations.description: (الفلّوجة) — a city with over 200 mosques now better known for the sieges and battles fought here.

destinations.title: Karbala
destinations.description: (كربلاء) — one of the holiest cities in Shi'a Islam. The Arbaeen pilgrimage brings millions of Muslims to the Imam Husayn Shrine here every year.

destinations.title: Kirkuk
destinations.description: (كركوك) — an important cultural capital to the Kurds, Turkmen and Iraqis.

destinations.title: Mosul
destinations.description: (موصل) — Once an important city in Iraq and containing the ancient ruins of Nineveh, now left mostly in ruins after battles with ISIL.

destinations.title: Sulaimaniyah
destinations.description: (سليمانى) — Iraqi Kurdistan's second city.

destinations.title: Assur
destinations.description: former capital of the Assyrian Empire and UNESCO World Heritage site, this is one of the country's few great archaeological sites that has benefited from the latest invasion—the Hussein government planned to create a dam nearby that would have flooded and utterly destroyed the site.

destinations.title: Babylon
destinations.description: (بابل) — damaged by inept reconstruction, looting, and military negligence, the ruins of ancient Babylon are still some of the most impressive in the Cradle of Civilization.

destinations.title: Ctesiphon
destinations.description: the ancient capital of the Parthian and Sassanid Empires left us with magnificent, towering ruins, most notably of the magnificent Arch of Ctesiphon; just across the Tigris is the archaeological site of the ancient Hellenistic city of Seleucia.

destinations.title: Hatra
destinations.description: once a UNESCO World Heritage site, this formerly well-preserved Parthian city off in the desert contained quite possibly Iraq's most magnificent ruins, which were severely damaged or destroyed by Da'esh extremists in 2015.

destinations.title: Nineveh
destinations.description: (نينوى) — a 3,000 year old city and one time capital of Assyria, whose partially reconstructed ruins and archaeological site lies across the Tigris from Mosul.

destinations.title: Ur
destinations.description: (أور) — the ruins of the ancient Sumerian city, best known for its giant step pyramid, the Great Ziggurat of Ur.

Ireland.title: Ireland
Ireland.summary: Ireland (Irish: Éire), also known as the Republic of Ireland (Irish: Poblacht na hÉireann), has a rich culture that, along with its people, has been exported around the world.
Ireland.description: Ireland (Irish: Éire), also known as the Republic of Ireland (Irish: Poblacht na hÉireann), has a rich culture that, along with its people, has been exported around the world.

sights.title: Trinity College Dublin
sights.description: constituent college of the University of Dublin in Ireland

destinations.title: Dublin
destinations.description: (Baile Átha Cliath) — the capital and largest city in Ireland. With excellent pubs, fine architecture and good shopping, Dublin is a very popular tourist destination and is the fourth most visited European capital.

destinations.title: Cork
destinations.description: (Corcaigh) — the country's second biggest city — on the banks of the River Lee. Founded c.600 by St Finbarre and known for great food (especially seafood), pubs, shopping and festivals.  If you venture outside of the city along the coastline which borders the Atlantic Ocean, you will find long windy beaches, beautiful villages with history, castles and an array of outdoor activities to enjoy.

destinations.title: Galway
destinations.description: (Gaillimh) — a city on the river Corrib on the west coast of Ireland. Famous for its festivals and its location on Galway Bay.  Known as the City of Tribes, Galway's summer is filled with festivals of music, food, Irish language and culture. Galway hosts over fifty festivals a year, including the Galway Oyster Festival.  The locals seem to give off a positive Bohemian vibe. Galway is split between two types of beautiful landscape: the gorgeous mountains to the west, and the east's farming valleys.

destinations.title: Killarney
destinations.description: (Cill Áirne)— Possibly, the most popular tourist destination in Ireland. A pleasant town in its own right, it is also the start of most Ring of Kerry trips.

destinations.title: Kilkenny
destinations.description: (Cill Chainnigh) — attractive medieval town, known as the Marble City — home to the Cat Laughs Comedy Festival, held annually in early June.

destinations.title: Letterkenny
destinations.description: (Leitir Ceanainn) — Main town in County Donegal, designated gateway status and reputed to be the fastest growing town in Europe. Good base for travelling in Donegal.

destinations.title: Limerick
destinations.description: (Luimneach) — a city strategically sited where the river Shannon broadens into its mighty estuary in the south-west of the country. First city to receive the designation of National City of Culture (2014).

destinations.title: Sligo
destinations.description: (Sligeach) — Home to W.B. Yeats, internationally renowned poet. Mountains and beaches, scenery in general are the best points of Sligo.

destinations.title: Waterford
destinations.description: (Port Láirge) — Ireland's oldest city. In the south-east and close to the ferry port at Rosslare. Waterford is a popular visit for those who want to learn more about the most ancient history of Ireland. It is quite possibly one of the best cities in the country as it is not too large and is full of history. Many festivals take place throughout the year including Spraoi. The food is good and the Granary Museum is the best for ancient Irish history in the country. Don't forget to try a blaa before you leave (a floury bread bun peculiar to this area of Ireland).

destinations.title: Aran Islands
destinations.description: (Oileáin Árann) — in Galway Bay

destinations.title: Brú Na Bóinne
destinations.description: in Co. Meath are some of the finest neolithic monuments in the world, the oldest of which is Newgrange, dating back to 3100 BC.

destinations.title: Burren
destinations.description: (Boirinn) and the Cliffs of Moher (Aillte an Mhothair) — both in the County Clare

destinations.title: Cliffs of Moher
destinations.description: (Boirinn) and the  (Aillte an Mhothair) — both in the County Clare

destinations.title: Connemara
destinations.description: (Conamara) — an Irish speaking region in Western County Galway

destinations.title: County Donegal
destinations.description: (Contae Dhún na nGall) — the coastal regions of this county have spectacular scenery and excellent beaches

destinations.title: Dingle Peninsula
destinations.description: (Corca Dhuibhne) — a Gaeltecht region (Irish-speaking district) in the very South West corner of Ireland

destinations.title: Glendalough
destinations.description: (Gleann Dá Loch) — fine ruins and hiking trails in Co. Wicklow

destinations.title: Kinsale
destinations.description: (Cionn tSáile) — gastronomic excellence in Ireland's oldest town

destinations.title: Ring of Kerry
destinations.description: and Skellig Michael — (Sceilg Mhichíl) in County Kerry

destinations.title: Skellig Michael
destinations.description: and  — (Sceilg Mhichíl) in County Kerry

destinations.title: West Cork
destinations.description: (Iarthar Chorcaí) — mountains, coves, islands and beaches at the very south of the country

Israel.title: Israel
Israel.summary: The State of Israel (Hebrew: מדינת ישראל; Arabic: دولة إسرائيل) is a small yet diverse Middle Eastern country bordered by Egypt and the Gaza Strip to the southwest, by the West Bank and Jordan to the east, and by Syria and Lebanon to the north. The country has a long coastline on the eastern Mediterranean Sea, and very limited access to the Red Sea at the Gulf of Aqaba (often called the Gulf of Eilat in Israel). Since 1967, Israel has controlled most of the West Bank (often called "Judea and Samaria" in Israel) as well as the Golan Heights. Israel has annexed East Jerusalem and the Golan, but most other countries, except the United States, reject the annexation, and consider these areas and the West Bank (which Israel did not annex, and Israeli law does not apply to the area) to be occupied Palestinian territory. Wikivoyage takes no stance on these political issues, but notes that in practice, current visitors to these areas will need Israeli visas and permits.
Israel.description: The State of Israel (Hebrew: מדינת ישראל; Arabic: دولة إسرائيل) is a small yet diverse Middle Eastern country bordered by Egypt and the Gaza Strip to the southwest, by the West Bank and Jordan to the east, and by Syria and Lebanon to the north. The country has a long coastline on the eastern Mediterranean Sea, and very limited access to the Red Sea at the Gulf of Aqaba (often called the Gulf of Eilat in Israel). Since 1967, Israel has controlled most of the West Bank (often called "Judea and Samaria" in Israel) as well as the Golan Heights. Israel has annexed East Jerusalem and the Golan, but most other countries, except the United States, reject the annexation, and consider these areas and the West Bank (which Israel did not annex, and Israeli law does not apply to the area) to be occupied Palestinian territory. Wikivoyage takes no stance on these political issues, but notes that in practice, current visitors to these areas will need Israeli visas and permits.

sights.title: Nimrod, Golan Heights
sights.description: Israeli settlement in the Golan Heights

sights.title: Negev
sights.description: desert and semidesert region of southern Israel

sights.title: Dead Sea
sights.description: salt lake bordering Jordan and Israel

sights.title: Eurasia
sights.description: continental landmass comprising Europe and Asia

sights.title: Yad Vashem
sights.description: Israel's official memorial to the Jewish victims of the Holocaust

sights.title: Israel National Trail
sights.description: hiking path that crosses the entire country of Israel

destinations.title: Jerusalem
destinations.description: – Israel's capital; a city sacred for millennia to the three Abrahamic religions (Jews, Christians and Muslims), and full of historic sites

destinations.title: Akko
destinations.description: (Acre) – an ancient town with a historic port and the most sacred Baha'i site. Its coastal old town is  particularly beautiful

destinations.title: Beer Sheva
destinations.description: – the de facto capital of the Negev region

destinations.title: Eilat
destinations.description: – the 'Goa of the Middle East', Israel's window on the Red Sea, a vibrant resort city

destinations.title: Haifa
destinations.description: – the largest city in northern Israel, on Mount Carmel next to the sea. Home to the Baha'i World Center (a UNESCO World Heritage site).

destinations.title: Nazareth
destinations.description: – the hometown of Jesus, now the largest Arab city in Israel

destinations.title: Safed
destinations.description: (Tzfat) – a fascinating mountaintop city filled with artists and mystics, home to ARI school of Kabbalah

destinations.title: Tel Aviv
destinations.description: – the center of Israel's economy and modern culture. Known as the "White City" for its Bauhaus architecture, it is full of skyscrapers, beaches, markets, and nightclubs

destinations.title: Tiberias
destinations.description: – a modern resort town with an ancient background, on the western shore of the Sea of Galilee

destinations.title: Jerusalem/Old City
destinations.description: – a historic walled area within the modern city of Jerusalem. Tourists of different religions and nations come from around the world to visit its holy sites, which include the Dome of the Rock, the Western Wall and the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. A UNESCO World Heritage site.

destinations.title: Akko
destinations.description: – One of the oldest port cities in the world, a UNESCO World Heritage site

destinations.title: Sea of Galilee region
destinations.description: – the home of Jesus of Nazareth and the largest freshwater lake in the country

destinations.title: Dead Sea (Israel)
destinations.description: – a sea of hypersalinated water that keeps people afloat and the lowest point on Earth

destinations.title: Jezreel Valley
destinations.description: – an extensive inland valley, largely rural, extending inland from east of Haifa to the Jordan Valley

destinations.title: Judaean Desert
destinations.description: – an arid landscape with an array of hills, canyons, and hidden historic sites

destinations.title: Haifa
destinations.description: – center of the Bahá'í Faith, home to the Shrine of the Báb and Terraces, in the northern city of Haifa

destinations.title: Masada
destinations.description: – high on a plateau above the Dead Sea, the scene of the Zealots' last stand against the might of Rome. A UNESCO World Heritage site.

destinations.title: Sde Boker
destinations.description: – beautiful steep canyon and a popular hiking spot

destinations.title: Caesarea
destinations.description: – an ancient Roman and Crusader city with well-preserved remains

destinations.title: Beth Shean Valley
destinations.description: – the core of the north Jordan River valley

destinations.title: Lower Galilee
destinations.description: – a Crusader fortress on a ridge in the eastern edge of the Galilee.

destinations.title: Golan Heights
destinations.description: – remains of a medieval fortress in the northern Golan Heights, 800 meters above sea level.

destinations.title: Mount Hermon
destinations.description: – The mountain is partly in Israel and partly  in Syria and Lebanon. The Israeli summit of the mountain is 2,224m above sea level and is the highest location in the country. The total area of the Hermon nature reserve is 76,250 hectares. Most of the nature reserve is in a restricted military area (except for Hermon Ski resort and the Banias springs area at the slopes of the mountain which are popular visited destination).

Italy.title: Italy
Italy.summary: Italy (Italian: Italia), officially the Italian Republic (Repubblica italiana), is a country in Southern Europe, occupying the Italian Peninsula and the Po Valley south of the Alps. Once the core of the mighty Roman Empire, and the cradle of the Renaissance, it is also home to the greatest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the world, including high art and monuments.
Italy.description: Italy (Italian: Italia), officially the Italian Republic (Repubblica italiana), is a country in Southern Europe, occupying the Italian Peninsula and the Po Valley south of the Alps. Once the core of the mighty Roman Empire, and the cradle of the Renaissance, it is also home to the greatest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites in the world, including high art and monuments.

Japan.title: Japan
Japan.summary: Japan, known as Nihon or Nippon (日本) in Japanese, is an island nation in East Asia. Its insular character has allowed it to develop a unique and very intricate culture, while its closeness to other ancient Far Eastern cultures, in particular China, has left lasting influence. Despite belonging to a forever warring nation, both internally and overseas, Japan's people had historically always placed emphasis on inner balance, tranquility and natural beauty. These traditional values have become increasingly important now that Japan has grown to be one of the world's most densely-populated countries, and its legendary work ethic makes life in its cities quite hectic.
Japan.description: Japan, known as Nihon or Nippon (日本) in Japanese, is an island nation in East Asia. Its insular character has allowed it to develop a unique and very intricate culture, while its closeness to other ancient Far Eastern cultures, in particular China, has left lasting influence. Despite belonging to a forever warring nation, both internally and overseas, Japan's people had historically always placed emphasis on inner balance, tranquility and natural beauty. These traditional values have become increasingly important now that Japan has grown to be one of the world's most densely-populated countries, and its legendary work ethic makes life in its cities quite hectic.
