Jordan.title: Jordan
Jordan.summary: Jordan (Arabic: الأردنّ al-Urdunn) is an Arab kingdom in Western Asia, on the East Bank of the Jordan River. Jordan is bordered by Saudi Arabia to the east and south, Iraq to the north-east, Syria to the north, Israel, the West Bank and the Dead Sea to the west and the Red Sea in its extreme south-west. Jordan is located at the crossroads of Asia, Africa and Europe. The capital, Amman, is Jordan's most populous city and the country's economic and cultural centre.

Jordan is bordered by Saudi Arabia to the east and south, Iraq to the north-east, Syria to the north, Israel, the West Bank and the Dead Sea to the west and the Red Sea in its extreme south-west. Jordan is located at the crossroads of Asia, Africa and Europe. The capital, Amman, is Jordan's most populous city and the country's economic and cultural centre.

Kazakhstan.title: Kazakhstan
Kazakhstan.summary: Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country and, as the world's ninth biggest country by area, is the largest of the former states of the former Soviet Union apart from Russia itself. It has borders with Russia, China, and the Central Asian countries of Turkmenistan, Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan, which it dwarfs.
Kazakhstan.description: Kazakhstan is the largest landlocked country and, as the world's ninth biggest country by area, is the largest of the former states of the former Soviet Union apart from Russia itself. It has borders with Russia, China, and the Central Asian countries of Turkmenistan, Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan, which it dwarfs.

This city is brand new and being built very rapidly. If you want to see what the old Aqmola looks like, you need to do it now as it is disappearing very rapidly.

Kosovo.title: Kosovo
Kosovo.summary: Kosovo (Albanian: Kosova, Serbian: Kосово и Метохија, Kosovo i Metohija) is a largely mountainous country in South Eastern Europe. Last to go its own way following the break up of former Yugoslavia, it declared independence in February 2008 but Serbia has not recognised it. Kosovo borders Albania from the west, Montenegro from the northwest, North Macedonia from the south, and Serbia to the northeast.

Kyrgyzstan.title: Kyrgyzstan
Kyrgyzstan.summary: Kyrgyzstan (Кыргызстан, formally the Kyrgyz Republic (Кыргыз Республикасы) is a Central Asian country of incredible natural beauty and proud nomadic traditions. Landlocked and mountainous, it borders Kazakhstan to the north, Uzbekistan to the west, Tajikistan to the southwest and China to the southeast. Annexed by Russia in 1876, it achieved independence from the Soviet Union in 1991. It has the most liberal tourist visa policy in Central Asia and one of the more progressive post-Soviet governments in the region. It is called the Switzerland of Central Asia.
Kyrgyzstan.description: Kyrgyzstan (Кыргызстан, formally the Kyrgyz Republic (Кыргыз Республикасы) is a Central Asian country of incredible natural beauty and proud nomadic traditions. Landlocked and mountainous, it borders Kazakhstan to the north, Uzbekistan to the west, Tajikistan to the southwest and China to the southeast. Annexed by Russia in 1876, it achieved independence from the Soviet Union in 1991. It has the most liberal tourist visa policy in Central Asia and one of the more progressive post-Soviet governments in the region. It is called the Switzerland of Central Asia.

destinations.title: Bishkek
destinations.description: – The capital and cosmopolitan center of the country, beautiful and interesting.

destinations.title: Balykchy
destinations.description: – The gateway to Issyk Kul lake. A small, dying industrial center on the western shore, and a former fishing town, with a train service from Bishkek through a beautiful passant Chui Valley.

destinations.title: Jalal-Abad
destinations.description: – A good bet for visiting a Ferghana Valley town, as it is significantly safer and easier to get to than Osh or destinations further southwest.

destinations.title: Karakol
destinations.description: – One of the gems of Issyk Kul, this was originally a Slavic settlement with a wealth of hiking, outdoor and sports available, including the Altyn Arashan hot springs, Karakol Canyon, and the beautiful Ala Kul glacier lake.

destinations.title: Kochkor
destinations.description: – A small village with a park containing various Soviet structures, and a local animal bazaar, as well as an entry of point for Song Kul and launch pad for treks up into the Tian Shan Mountains.

destinations.title: Naryn
destinations.description: – A city right up in the Tian Shan, near Lake Song Kul, the gateway to the entire southeastern region, its ruins, mountains, and high alpine lakes.

destinations.title: Osh
destinations.description: – Kyrgyzstan's second largest city, a fascinating, 3,000 years old, wildly diverse, Ferghana Valley market town home to Central Asia's biggest and busiest outdoor market.

destinations.title: Talas
destinations.description: – A modern far off town with the popular Manar Ordo pilgrimage complex nearby, just north of Besh-Tash National Park.

destinations.title: Tokmok
destinations.description: – Dwarfed by nearby Bishkek, but still large by Kyrgyzstani standards, Tokmok is a dull industrial center right by the ancient Burana Tower and the ruins of an ancient Silk Road capital, Ak-Beshim.

destinations.title: Issyk Kul
destinations.description: Lake and pearl of Central Asia, an enormous, crystal blue high alpine lake up in the Tian Shan Mountains.

destinations.title: Song Kul
destinations.description: Issyk Kul's little cousin, far more remote, and many would say more beautiful as well.

destinations.title: Issyk Kul and the Tian Shan
destinations.description: A former well-preserved 15th century stone caravanserai near Naryn and must see.

destinations.title: Bishkek and the Northwest
destinations.description: One of the highlights of Kyrgyzstan with a beautiful lake, excellent hiking, diverse flora and fauna, picturesque mountains and much more.

Laos.title: Laos
Laos.summary: Laos (ສປປ ລາວ), officially known as the Lao People's Democratic Republic (ສາທາລະນະລັດ ປະຊາທິປະໄຕ ປະຊາຊົນລາວ) (Lao PDR), is a nation in Southeast Asia, known for its mountainous terrain, French colonial architecture, hill tribe settlements, and Buddhist monasteries. A mountainous and landlocked country, Laos shares borders with Vietnam to the east, Cambodia to the south, Thailand to the west, and Myanmar and China to the north.
Laos.description: Laos (ສປປ ລາວ), officially known as the Lao People's Democratic Republic (ສາທາລະນະລັດ ປະຊາທິປະໄຕ ປະຊາຊົນລາວ) (Lao PDR), is a nation in Southeast Asia, known for its mountainous terrain, French colonial architecture, hill tribe settlements, and Buddhist monasteries. A mountainous and landlocked country, Laos shares borders with Vietnam to the east, Cambodia to the south, Thailand to the west, and Myanmar and China to the north.

Latvia.title: Latvia
Latvia.summary: Latvia (Latvian: Latvija) is a European country with a coastline on the Baltic Sea. Being one of the three Baltic states, it shares its border with Estonia to the north and Lithuania to the south. It is also bordered by Russia on the east, Belarus on the south east and the Baltic Sea on the west.
Latvia.description: Latvia (Latvian: Latvija) is a European country with a coastline on the Baltic Sea. Being one of the three Baltic states, it shares its border with Estonia to the north and Lithuania to the south. It is also bordered by Russia on the east, Belarus on the south east and the Baltic Sea on the west.

destinations.description: – A popular holiday and sea resort town with wooden houses just west of Riga, which claims to have the longest beach in Northern Europe. Very popular with Russian and other eastern European tourists.

destinations.title: Daugavpils
destinations.description: – The second largest city in Latvia, after Riga. It is a delightfully charming, spacious, green city with the biggest fortress in Europe, which has withstood many many wars and remains virtually unchanged since its construction in the 19th century.

destinations.title: Ventspils
destinations.description: – A modern and artistic sea resort city in the north-west part of Latvia, has many things to see, and is one of the tidiest places in the region. A long-stretching beach and recreational park provide everything for a relaxing holiday week or weekend. It gets its prosperity from the huge ice-free port, which is the busiest port in the Baltic states, and the oil transit business.

destinations.title: Liepāja
destinations.description: – Named "the city of wind", and the southwestern most city of Latvia. Famous for its sandy beach, numerous music events, and the largest organ in the world. It features modern architecture and a long history along with the formerly secret Soviet military neighbourhood of Karosta (literally: War Port).

destinations.title: Kuldīga
destinations.description: – The capital of Duchy of Courland, Venice of Latvia, with unique and wooden architecture, red-tile roofs, bridges, cobbled streets, the widest widest waterfall ledge in Europe, and nearby the longest underground (sand) cave labyrinth in the Baltics.

destinations.title: Madona
destinations.description: – A scenic town surrounded by hills, forests and lakes, and a winter sports centre.

destinations.title: Riga region
destinations.description: planning Region in Latvia

destinations.title: Kurzeme
destinations.description: historic region

Lebanon.title: Lebanon
Lebanon.summary: The Republic of Lebanon (Arabic: لبنان) is a country in the Middle East at the Mediterranean Sea. It borders Syria to the north and the east, and Israel to the south.
Lebanon.description: The Republic of Lebanon (Arabic: لبنان) is a country in the Middle East at the Mediterranean Sea. It borders Syria to the north and the east, and Israel to the south.

destinations.title: Beirut
destinations.description: the capital and largest city

destinations.title: Baalbek
destinations.description: a Phoenician and Roman archaeological site

destinations.title: Byblos
destinations.description: (Joubeil) - another city with plenty of remains, castles and museums

destinations.title: Jezzine
destinations.description: main summer resort and tourist destination of South Lebanon

destinations.title: Jounieh
destinations.description: known for its seaside resorts and nightclubs

destinations.title: Sidon

destinations.title: Tripoli (Lebanon)
destinations.description: (Trablus) - still unspoilt by mass-tourism

destinations.title: Tyre

destinations.title: Zahle
destinations.description: capital of Bekaa Valley

destinations.title: Jeita
destinations.description: Known for its Grotto

destinations.title: Kadisha Valley
destinations.description: You can visit the home of the (now deceased) Lebanese poet Khalil Gibran.

destinations.title: Deir el Qamar
destinations.description: Traditional village in Chouf district.

Lesotho.title: Lesotho
Lesotho.summary: Lesotho is a small country that is totally surrounded by South Africa. It's known as the Kingdom in the Sky because the entire country is at a high altitude. Its lowest point is 1,400 m above sea level – no other country in the world has its lowest point above 1000 m (3,280 ft)! Lesotho is a fantastic adventure holiday destination because of its smiling and resourceful people and bracing climate.
Lesotho.description: Lesotho is a small country that is totally surrounded by South Africa. It's known as the Kingdom in the Sky because the entire country is at a high altitude. Its lowest point is 1,400 m above sea level – no other country in the world has its lowest point above 1000 m (3,280 ft)! Lesotho is a fantastic adventure holiday destination because of its smiling and resourceful people and bracing climate.

destinations.title: Hlotse

destinations.title: Ts'ehlanyane National Park

destinations.title: Katse

destinations.title: Malealea

destinations.title: Morija

destinations.title: Semonkong
destinations.description: Maletsunyane Falls — one of the highest single drop waterfalls in the world

Liberia.title: Liberia
Liberia.summary: Liberia is in West Africa and is bordered by Sierra Leone, Guinea, and Côte d'Ivoire. Along with Ethiopia, it was one of the only two countries to be uncolonized during the Scramble for Africa.
Liberia.description: Liberia is in West Africa and is bordered by Sierra Leone, Guinea, and Côte d'Ivoire. Along with Ethiopia, it was one of the only two countries to be uncolonized during the Scramble for Africa.

destinations.title: Monrovia
destinations.description: the capital and with a population of around one million people is Liberia's largest city.

destinations.title: Robertsport
destinations.description: Coastal town with excellent surfing opportunities, a comfortable holiday lodge and a beachside campsite.

destinations.title: Harper
destinations.description: Located at the southeast of the country, Harper is the former capital of Maryland. It is known for its beautiful beaches and beach houses. Now these houses are dilapidated but its still possible to get a sense of the glory of the past.

destinations.title: Paynesville (Liberia)
destinations.description: interesting for BASE jumpers

destinations.title: Sapo National Park

destinations.title: Providence Island
destinations.description: is a tiny island between downtown Monrovia and the Freeport.  It lies at the mouth of the Mesurado River where early settlers to Liberia first settled between 1820 and 1822.

destinations.title: Lake Piso
destinations.description: is located in Grand Cape Mount County and is a saltwater lake with an open connection to the Atlantic Ocean.

destinations.title: Atlantic Coastal Beaches
destinations.description: Bernard's Beach, CeCe Beach, ELWA Beach, Kendejah Beach, Kenema Beach, Thinkers Village Beach.

Libya.title: Libya
Libya.summary: Libya (Arabic: ‏ليبيا Lībyā) is a country in North Africa. In the north it has a Mediterranean Sea coast, with Egypt to the east and Tunisia to the west. It also has land borders with Algeria, Chad, Niger and Sudan. More than 90% of the country is desert or semidesert.
Libya.description: Libya (Arabic: ‏ليبيا Lībyā) is a country in North Africa. In the north it has a Mediterranean Sea coast, with Egypt to the east and Tunisia to the west. It also has land borders with Algeria, Chad, Niger and Sudan. More than 90% of the country is desert or semidesert.

sights.title: Acacus Mountains

Liechtenstein.summary: The Principality of Liechtenstein (German: Fürstentum Liechtenstein) is a tiny, alpine, German-speaking country landlocked by Switzerland and Austria.
Liechtenstein.description: The Principality of Liechtenstein (German: Fürstentum Liechtenstein) is a tiny, alpine, German-speaking country landlocked by Switzerland and Austria.

Lithuania.title: Lithuania
Lithuania.summary: Lithuania (Lithuanian: Lietuva) is a Baltic country in northeastern Europe. It has a Baltic Sea coastline in the west and borders with Latvia to the north, Belarus to the east, Poland to the southwest, and Russia (Kaliningrad Oblast) to the west.
Lithuania.description: Lithuania (Lithuanian: Lietuva) is a Baltic country in northeastern Europe. It has a Baltic Sea coastline in the west and borders with Latvia to the north, Belarus to the east, Poland to the southwest, and Russia (Kaliningrad Oblast) to the west.

Luxembourg.title: Luxembourg
Luxembourg.summary: The Grand Duchy of Luxembourg (Luxembourgish: Groussherzogtum Lëtzebuerg, French: Grand-Duché de Luxembourg, German: Großherzogtum Luxemburg), is a landlocked Benelux country bordered by Belgium, France and Germany at the crossroads of Germanic and Latin cultures. It is the only Grand Duchy in the world and is the second-smallest of the European Union member states by area. A founding member of the European Community of Coal and Steel, Luxembourg has produced a number of prominent EU level politicians.
Luxembourg.description: The Grand Duchy of Luxembourg (Luxembourgish: Groussherzogtum Lëtzebuerg, French: Grand-Duché de Luxembourg, German: Großherzogtum Luxemburg), is a landlocked Benelux country bordered by Belgium, France and Germany at the crossroads of Germanic and Latin cultures. It is the only Grand Duchy in the world and is the second-smallest of the European Union member states by area. A founding member of the European Community of Coal and Steel, Luxembourg has produced a number of prominent EU level politicians.

destinations.description: Small castle town home to the Family of Man photo exposition

destinations.title: Schengen

North Macedonia.title: North Macedonia
North Macedonia.summary: The Republic of North Macedonia (Macedonian: Северна Македонија, Severna Makedonija; formerly the Republic of Macedonia, also FYROM and FYR Macedonia, Macedonian: Македонија, Makedonija) is a landlocked country in the heart of the Balkans. It is bordered by Serbia and Kosovo to the north, Albania to the west, Bulgaria to the east, and Greece to the south.
North Macedonia.description: The Republic of North Macedonia (Macedonian: Северна Македонија, Severna Makedonija; formerly the Republic of Macedonia, also FYROM and FYR Macedonia, Macedonian: Македонија, Makedonija) is a landlocked country in the heart of the Balkans. It is bordered by Serbia and Kosovo to the north, Albania to the west, Bulgaria to the east, and Greece to the south.

sights.title: Church of St. John at Kaneo
sights.description: Macedonian Orthodox church building in Ohrid, North Macedonia

destinations.title: Skopje
destinations.description: (Скопје) — the nation's capital, home to many historic landmarks and architectural monuments, and a great number of cultural places of interest

destinations.title: Bitola
destinations.description: (Битола) — North Macedonia's most "European" town, with an ancient city, Ottoman monuments, a lovely shopping promenade, great nightlife, and more

destinations.title: Kratovo
destinations.description: (Кратово) — a picturesque town situated in an extinct volcano crater

destinations.title: Kruševo
destinations.description: (Крушево) — a museum-city nestled high up in the mountains of southwestern North Macedonia; it is one the most historically significant destinations in the country as it was the site of a revolt against the Ottoman Empire; also home to great skiing

destinations.title: Ohrid
destinations.description: (Охрид) — a lakeside resort and UNESCO World Heritage Site, it is considered the jewel in North Macedonia's crown

destinations.title: Prilep
destinations.description: (Прилеп) — tobacco fields, medieval fortifications and monasteries, and strange rocks

destinations.title: Strumica
destinations.description: (Струмица) — a city with one of the highest concentrations of historical sites in Eastern North Macedonia

destinations.title: Veles
destinations.description: (Велес) — in the center of the country, a dense city on hills on both sides of the Vardar

destinations.title: Galičica National Park
destinations.description: consists of the mountainous land between Lake Ohrid and Lake Prespa.

destinations.title: Mavrovo National Park
destinations.description: the largest of North Macedonia's national parks. It is home to the country's highest peak, Golem Korab, as well as several picturesque villages and monasteries.

destinations.title: Pelister National Park
destinations.description: separates Bitola from Prespa. It covers the Baba Mountain area and features two glacial lakes known as "Mountain Eyes" that feed multiple rivers.

destinations.title: Prespa (Macedonia)
destinations.description: (Преспа) — contains most of the Great Prespa Lake, shared by neighbouring countries. Galičica to the west and Pelister to the east complement the scenery provided by the lake.

destinations.title: Stobi
destinations.description: (Стоби) — an ancient city that is now one of the largest archaeological sites in the country.

destinations.title: Vevčani
destinations.description: (Вевчани, Vevchani) — historic mountain village known for its natural springs, its 1,400-year-old annual carnival and its attempts at autonomy

Madagascar.title: Madagascar
Madagascar.summary: Madagascar, formerly the Malagasy Republic, is a country in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. It is the fourth largest island in the world.
Madagascar.description: Madagascar, formerly the Malagasy Republic, is a country in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. It is the fourth largest island in the world.

Malawi.title: Malawi
Malawi.summary: Malawi (Chichewa: Malaŵi) is a country in Africa, bordered by Mozambique to the south and east, Tanzania to the north, Zambia to the west. Lake Malawi, the third largest lake in Africa, runs along most of its eastern border. It's described as the "Warm Heart of Africa", referring to the friendliness of the people.
Malawi.description: Malawi (Chichewa: Malaŵi) is a country in Africa, bordered by Mozambique to the south and east, Tanzania to the north, Zambia to the west. Lake Malawi, the third largest lake in Africa, runs along most of its eastern border. It's described as the "Warm Heart of Africa", referring to the friendliness of the people.

destinations.title: Lilongwe
destinations.description: political capital of Malawi and the seat of government

destinations.title: Blantyre
destinations.description: economic capital and largest city with an interesting downtown, decent nightlife and music, a range of hotels from the elegant to resthouses, and a vibrant street and market culture

destinations.title: Karonga
destinations.description: charming town not far from the intriguing Misuku Hills and a short distance from Lake Malawi and growing quickly because of the recent development of a uranium mine

destinations.title: Mangochi
destinations.description: medium-sized town, formerly known as Fort Johnston, and a jumping-off point for the resorts and hostels up the coast of Lake Malawi, on the way to peninsular Cape Maclear

destinations.title: Monkey Bay
destinations.description: a popular large village as you head up the Lake Road from Mangochi toward Cape Maclear

destinations.title: Nkhata Bay
destinations.description: a rocky bay towards the north of the lake - check into one of the lodges and you could be here for a while

destinations.title: Nkhotakota
destinations.description: on the shores of Lake Malawi in the Central Region, is where the explorer David Livingston sat down with the Swahili Arab slave traders to attempt to negotiate an end to the slave trade. Nkhotakota was a slave entrepôt, from which slaves were ferried across Lake Malawi to the eastern shore to resume their travel over land to what is now the Tanzanian coast. Nkhotakota is a compact and fascinating town, old in its way and true to the ethnic diversity of this region of Malawi.

destinations.title: Zomba
destinations.description: old colonial capital of Malawi noted for its British colonial architecture, the University of Malawi, and the remarkable Zomba Plateau which rises immediately west of the city

destinations.title: Cape Maclear
destinations.description: laid back fishing village on the tip of a peninsula jutting out into the southern portion of Lake Malawi.  The Cape has excellent, sandy beaches and crystal-clear water perfect for swimming, and is a favourite among backpackers, boaters, and sunseekers. This area, however, is known for having a high level of schistosomiasis and visitors should be well informed.

destinations.title: Likoma Island
destinations.description: and Chisumulu Islands - great aquatic life and a back door to Mozambique. These islands are only reachable to tourists by private boat or the public ferry which only runs 1-2 times each week and is the sole means by which locals can ship supplies to and from the islands; Thus, if you take the ferry to or from Nkhata Bay, purchase a deck or cabin ticket unless you want to be fully immersed in the typical way of life of Malawian transporters.

destinations.title: Mua
destinations.description: human settlement in Malawi

destinations.title: Lake Malawi National Park
destinations.description: national park

destinations.title: Liwonde National Park
destinations.description: 550 km² of unspoiled forest along the shores of the Shire River. The national park is best approached from the town of Liwonde.  A half-hour boat ride up the Shire will show some of the remarkable wildlife of the region, especially hippo's, elephant, and fish eagles.

destinations.title: Majete Wildlife Park
destinations.description: wildlife reserve in Malawi

destinations.title: Nyika National Park
destinations.description: Malawi's biggest national park is on the 1800m high Nyika Plateau

destinations.title: Ntchisi Forest Reserve
destinations.description: stunning rainforest in rural, untouched area

destinations.title: South Luangwa National Park
destinations.description: Kiboko Camp and some other travel agencies run roundtrip safaris from Lilongwe to this fantastic national park in Zambia.

Malaysia.title: Malaysia
Malaysia.summary: Malaysia is a country in Southeast Asia, on the Malay peninsula, as well as on northern Borneo. The country is one of Asia's new tiger economies, having seen great economic and human development during the last decades. While the capital Kuala Lumpur is a cosmopolitan city, deep jungles cover some of the land.
Malaysia.description: Malaysia is a country in Southeast Asia, on the Malay peninsula, as well as on northern Borneo. The country is one of Asia's new tiger economies, having seen great economic and human development during the last decades. While the capital Kuala Lumpur is a cosmopolitan city, deep jungles cover some of the land.

Maldives.title: Maldives
Maldives.summary: The Maldives (Dhivehi: ދިވެހިރާއްޖެ Dhivehi Raajje)  are an archipelago of 1,192 coral islands grouped into 26 coral atolls (200 inhabited islands, plus 80 islands with tourist resorts) in the Indian Ocean. They lie south-southwest of India and are considered part of South Asia.
Maldives.description: The Maldives (Dhivehi: ދިވެހިރާއްޖެ Dhivehi Raajje)  are an archipelago of 1,192 coral islands grouped into 26 coral atolls (200 inhabited islands, plus 80 islands with tourist resorts) in the Indian Ocean. They lie south-southwest of India and are considered part of South Asia.

destinations.description: the capital and largest city

destinations.title: Seenu
destinations.description: second-largest city and short-lived home of the Suvadive secessionist movement

destinations.title: Kuredu
destinations.description: one of the inhabited islands of Lhaviyani Atoll

destinations.title: Mathiveri
destinations.description: island belonging to North Ari Atoll

destinations.title: Rasdhoo
destinations.description: smallish inhabited island and the capital of the North Ari Atoll

destinations.title: Thoddoo
destinations.description: an isolated inhabited island that administratively belongs to North Ari Atoll. It's also the largest producer of watermelon in Maldives.

destinations.title: Ukulhas
destinations.description: smallish 1 km long island of Alif Alif Atoll

Mali.title: Mali
Mali.summary: A landlocked country in the Sahel, Mali is  bordered by Algeria, Niger, Burkina Faso, Cote d'Ivoire, Guinea, Senegal and Mauritania. Mali remains one of the poorest countries in the world, but it has wonderful musicians and some incredible sights, including four UNESCO World Heritage sites, and the historic city of Timbuktu.
Mali.description: A landlocked country in the Sahel, Mali is  bordered by Algeria, Niger, Burkina Faso, Cote d'Ivoire, Guinea, Senegal and Mauritania. Mali remains one of the poorest countries in the world, but it has wonderful musicians and some incredible sights, including four UNESCO World Heritage sites, and the historic city of Timbuktu.

sights.title: Great Mosque of Mecca
sights.description: Grand Masjid in Saudi Arabia, Al-Masjid al-Ḥarām

destinations.title: Bamako
destinations.description: the booming capital and largest city by far, fastest growing city in Africa, with a good claim to be the music capital of West Africa

destinations.title: Gao
destinations.description: small city on the Niger in the far east of the country, one time capital of the Songhai Empire, and home to the Tomb of Askia

destinations.title: Kayes
destinations.description: Mali's westernmost big city, by the border with Senegal, and best known for being the hottest continuously inhabited location in Africa

destinations.title: Kidal
destinations.description: a remote Tuareg city, with notoriety as a centre of the Tuareg rebel movement and for Al Qaeda activity

destinations.title: Mopti
destinations.description: a city across three islands in the middle of the Niger; gateway to Dogon Country

destinations.title: Ségou
destinations.description: Mali's third largest city and one-time capital of the Bamana Empire

destinations.title: Sikasso
destinations.description: Mali's second largest city and one-time capital of the Kénédougou Empire

destinations.title: Timbuktu
destinations.description: the legendary Saharan city of gold, trans-Saharan trade, and Islamic scholarship is nowadays a (fairly commercialized) centre of Tuareg culture.

destinations.title: Adrar des Ifoghas
destinations.description: a sandstone plateau in the Sahara home to rock paintings, salt mines operated for centuries, and a surprising array of wildlife.

destinations.title: Dogon Country
destinations.description: a trek through this landscape of scattered cliff-side villages is not to be missed by any Mali visitor. The famous Bandiagara Escarpment is a World Heritage Site

destinations.title: Djenné
destinations.description: once a religious and commercial centre to rival Timbuktu, this small town of multi-storey mud buildings is quite a sight. It has declared a World Heritage site by UNESCO.  Seeing Djenné from a rooftop offers an intriguing and unusual landscape, with its soft texture, rounded lines and melancholic colouring.  It also features the largest mosque in the world made completely out of mud, which is restored every year by the community after the rainy season.

Malta.title: Malta
Malta.summary: Malta is an island country in the Mediterranean Sea that lies south of the island of Sicily, Italy.  The country is an archipelago, with only the three largest islands (Malta, Għawdex or Gozo, and Kemmuna or Comino) being inhabited.
Malta.description: Malta is an island country in the Mediterranean Sea that lies south of the island of Sicily, Italy.  The country is an archipelago, with only the three largest islands (Malta, Għawdex or Gozo, and Kemmuna or Comino) being inhabited.

destinations.title: Valletta
destinations.description: – the capital, named for Jean Parisot de la Valette, a French nobleman who was Grand Master of the Order of St. John and leader of the defenders during the Turkish siege of Malta in 1565.  Valletta is a UNESCO World Heritage site for the massive number of historical buildings found in a tiny space.

destinations.title: Cottonera
destinations.description: (Three Cities) – The name used when referring to the three historic and ancient cities of Birgu (aka Vittoriosa), Isla (aka Senglea) and Bormla (aka Cospicua), three towns conglomerated by 16th century fortifications called the Cottonera lines.

destinations.title: Marsaxlokk
destinations.description: – fishing village south of the island.  A big market is held every Sunday.

destinations.title: Mdina
destinations.description: – Malta's well-preserved quiet old capital. pronounced 'im-dina'

destinations.title: Mosta
destinations.description: – 3rd largest city (in population) of Malta.

destinations.title: Rabat (Malta)
destinations.description: – hosts numerous historical attractions such as St. Paul's catacombs and the Domus Romana (previously known as Roman Villa)

destinations.title: St. Julian's
destinations.description: – perfect area for nightlife & entertainment.

destinations.title: Sliema
destinations.description: – shopping area just north of Valletta.

destinations.title: Victoria (Malta)
destinations.description: – the main town on Gozo.

destinations.title: Żejtun
destinations.description: – the largest city in the south of Malta and one of the oldest cities in Malta.

destinations.title: Hagar Qim and Mnajdra
destinations.description: – Two very beautiful stone age temples set on the cliffside of south west Malta.

destinations.title: Mellieħa
destinations.description: – A locality in Malta surrounded by the largest and some of the most wonderful sandy beaches on the Islands

destinations.title: Golden Bay (Malta)
destinations.description: – One of Malta's most beautiful sandy beaches, on the northwest coast of the island; the Radisson Hotel overlooking it damages the view somewhat, unless you're looking at the view from inside the hotel.

Marshall Islands.title: Marshall Islands
Marshall Islands.summary: The Marshall Islands are a group of atolls and reefs in the Pacific Ocean, about half-way between Hawaii and Australia.
Marshall Islands.description: The Marshall Islands are a group of atolls and reefs in the Pacific Ocean, about half-way between Hawaii and Australia.

destinations.title: Majuro
destinations.description: coral atoll, capital of the Marshall Islands

destinations.title: Kwajalein
destinations.description: atoll

destinations.title: Ebeye
destinations.description: island in the Marshall Islands

Mauritania.title: Mauritania
Mauritania.summary: Mauritania is the least developed and poorest country in northwest Africa. Geographically part of the Maghreb, Mauritania borders Algeria, Senegal and Mali, along with the disputed territory of Western Sahara.
Mauritania.description: Mauritania is the least developed and poorest country in northwest Africa. Geographically part of the Maghreb, Mauritania borders Algeria, Senegal and Mali, along with the disputed territory of Western Sahara.

destinations.title: Nouakchott
destinations.description: , the capital of Mauritania.

destinations.title: Atar
destinations.description: city in Mauritania

destinations.title: Chinguetti
destinations.description: human settlement in Mauritania

destinations.title: Nouadhibou
destinations.description: , large fishing centre and industrial harbour.

destinations.title: Tichit
destinations.description: village in Mauretania

destinations.title: Banc d'Arguin National Park
destinations.description: a breeding site for many different species of migratory birds, this coastal national park is a world heritage site.

Mauritius.title: Mauritius
Mauritius.summary: Mauritius (French: Maurice, Mauritian Creole: Moris) is an island nation in the Indian Ocean about 2,000 km (1,200 mi) from the African continent. The country consists of the main island of Mauritius and the smaller islands of Rodrigues, the Agalegas and the Cargados Carajos shoals. Mauritius is mostly appreciated by visitors for its natural beauty and man-made attractions, multi-ethnic and cultural diversity, tropical climate, beautiful beaches and water sports.
Mauritius.description: Mauritius (French: Maurice, Mauritian Creole: Moris) is an island nation in the Indian Ocean about 2,000 km (1,200 mi) from the African continent. The country consists of the main island of Mauritius and the smaller islands of Rodrigues, the Agalegas and the Cargados Carajos shoals. Mauritius is mostly appreciated by visitors for its natural beauty and man-made attractions, multi-ethnic and cultural diversity, tropical climate, beautiful beaches and water sports.

destinations.title: Port Louis
destinations.description: capital of Mauritius

destinations.title: Beau Bassin-Rose Hill
destinations.description: , the country's second biggest settlement.

destinations.title: Curepipe
destinations.description: is the largest highland city in Mauritius.

destinations.title: Quatre Bornes
destinations.description: human settlement

destinations.title: Vacoas-Phoenix
destinations.description: administrative territorial entity of Mauritius

destinations.title: Blue Bay
destinations.description: , bluest water and most amazing white sand beaches you will ever see.

destinations.title: Centre de Flacq
destinations.description: one of the most important villages in Mauritius. This meeting point for inhabitants of the East boasts the country’s largest open air market. This extremely colourful market attracts a large number of people.

destinations.title: Chamarel
destinations.description: human settlement

destinations.title: Grand Bay
destinations.description: Grand-Baie, a shopping and leisure paradise. With adjoining Pereybère beach resort.

destinations.title: Flic en Flac
destinations.description: , a local fishing village that has expanded to become a popular destination for tourists and expats.

destinations.title: Mahébourg
destinations.description: is one of the main fishing villages on the island.

destinations.title: Pamplemousses
destinations.description: village in the district of the same name

destinations.title: Souillac
destinations.description: A small seaside resort along the rugged coast of the Savanne district. Nearby La Vanille Réserve des Mascareignes.

destinations.title: Tamarin (Mauritius)
destinations.description: human settlement in Mauritius

destinations.title: Triolet
destinations.description: The longest village on the island, Triolet offers an opportunity to visit the biggest Hindu temple, the Maheswarnath, first built in 1819 in honour of the Gods Shiva, Krishna, Vishnu, Muruga, Brahma and Ganesha.

destinations.title: Trou d'Eau Douce
destinations.description: Located in the east, visitors may easily visit L'Ile aux Cerf from there

destinations.title: Agaléga
destinations.description: a pair of outer islands 1000 km north of the main island

destinations.title: Rodrigues
destinations.description: a separate island 500 km east of the main island, but under the political control of Mauritius

destinations.title: Le Morne
destinations.description: cultural landscape A peninsula and an eponymous mountain in the southwest of Mauritius. Inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List

Mexico.title: Mexico
Mexico.summary: Mexico (Spanish: México),  the United Mexican States (Spanish: Estados Unidos Mexicanos), is a country in North America, between the United States of America to the north, and Guatemala and Belize to the southeast. Its coastlines include the Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean Sea to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west.
Mexico.description: Mexico (Spanish: México),  the United Mexican States (Spanish: Estados Unidos Mexicanos), is a country in North America, between the United States of America to the north, and Guatemala and Belize to the southeast. Its coastlines include the Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean Sea to the east and the Pacific Ocean to the west.

sights.title: Guerrero Negro
sights.description: town located in the municipality of Mulegé in the Mexican state of Baja California Sur

sights.title: Baja California Peninsula
sights.description: peninsula of North America on the Pacific Coast of Mexico

sights.title: Toluca
sights.description: City in the capital municipality of Mexico State

links.text: Autobuses De Oriente (ADO), Omnibus Cristobal Colon (OCC), Autobus Unidos (AU)
El Paso-Los Angeles Limousines and Los Limousines
Chihuahua al Pacific Railway (CHEPE) operated by Ferromex

destinations.title: Mexico City
destinations.description: Capital of the Republic, one of the three largest cities in the world, and a sophisticated urban hub with a 700-year history. In Mexico City, you will find everything from parks, Aztec ruins, colonial architecture, museums, to nightlife and shopping.

destinations.title: Acapulco
destinations.description: A sophisticated urban beach setting known for its top-notch nightlife, elegant dining, and nightmarish traffic.  Many of the older (pre-1990s) concrete structures have suffered tropical decay.

destinations.title: Cancún
destinations.description: One of the worlds most popular and famous beaches, known for its clear Caribbean waters, its lively party atmosphere, and its wealth of recreational facilities.  During the U.S. college Spring Break (mid-Feb to the end of March) it is noted for drinking, sunburns, and debauchery.

destinations.title: Guadalajara
destinations.description: A traditional city, capital of Jalisco state, and the home of mariachi music and tequila. Guadalajara is blessed with perpetual spring weather and its colonial downtown is graceful and sophisticated.

destinations.title: Mazatlan
destinations.description: Lively Pacific coast town, Mazatlan is a shipping port, a transportation hub with ferries to Baja California, and a beach resort destination with miles of sandy shore. It is a popular U.S. college Spring Break destination due to its variety of affordable lodging options.

destinations.title: Monterrey
destinations.description: A large modern city that is the commercial and industrial hub of Northern Mexico. Monterrey enjoys a dry, mountainous setting and is known for its high-quality educational and transportation infrastructure.

destinations.title: San Luis Potosi
destinations.description: Located in central Mexico, a colonial city that was once an important silver producer, but today, relies on manufacturing for its economic base.

destinations.title: Taxco
destinations.description: In central Mexico west of Cuernavaca, this nice steep mountain town was once a major silver producer, and now has a strong place in the trade of decorative silver, from cheap fittings to the most elegant jewelry and elaborate castings.

destinations.title: Tijuana
destinations.description: Mexico's busiest border crossing for pedestrians and private vehicles, and a long-time bargain Mecca for southern Californians due to its proximity to San Diego.

destinations.title: Copper Canyon
destinations.description: (Barrancas del Cobre) - An exotic destination for travelers looking for a unique remote adventure! An awesome mountain rail ride -- one of the greatest in the world -- takes you upwards over 2,440 m (8000 feet) on the CHEPE, the Chihuahua al Pacifico Railway. Hiking, horseback riding, birding, and Tarahumara Indians. Copper Canyon, the Sierra Madre and the Chihuahuan desert of Mexico. This area is designed for adventurous individuals who will tolerate some rough travel to get to their point(s) of interest (although the famous train ride isn't demanding at all). Copper Canyon, a magnificent remote wilderness is not likely ever to become a mass market destination.

destinations.title: Chiapas
destinations.description: From docks on the Rio Grijalva (the only major river within Mexico) near Tuxtla Gutiérrez in Chiapas state, tour launches take you into this steep-walled National Park. You'll likely see vast flocks of flamingos, pelicans, and other waterfowl, as well as crocodiles.

destinations.title: Chichen Itza
destinations.description: Majestic Mayan city, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1988 and was voted as one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

destinations.title: Ek Balam
destinations.description: A reconstructed Mayan site, famous for its unique decorated stucco and stone carved temples that you can climb.

destinations.title: El Tajín
destinations.description: In the state of Veracruz near the town of Papantla. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

destinations.title: Monte Alban
destinations.description: In the state of Oaxaca, a Zapotec site dating from about 500 BC. A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

destinations.title: Palenque
destinations.description: Mayan city in the state of Chiapas, Palenque famous for its elaborate paintings. Also well known for having the largest tract of rainforest in Mexico located in the same area.

destinations.title: Teotihuacan
destinations.description: In the state of Mexico, near Mexico City. Enormous site with several large pyramids.

destinations.title: Tulum
destinations.description: Mayan coastal city with spectacular Caribbean vistas. Dates from late Mayan period.

destinations.title: Uxmal
destinations.description: Impressive Mayan city-state in the Puc Region, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1996.

destinations.title: Chetumal
destinations.description: city on the east coast of the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico

destinations.title: Belmopan
destinations.description: capital of Belize

destinations.title: Guatemala
destinations.description: republic in Central America

Federated States of Micronesia.title: Federated States of Micronesia
Federated States of Micronesia.summary: The Federated States of Micronesia is a country in the northwestern Pacific Ocean. It is composed of four major island groups totaling 607 islands that lie just north of the equator about three-quarters of the way from Hawaii to Indonesia, to the north of Papua New Guinea and the Solomon Islands and to the south of the Marshall Islands, the Northern Mariana Islands and Guam.
Federated States of Micronesia.description: The Federated States of Micronesia is a country in the northwestern Pacific Ocean. It is composed of four major island groups totaling 607 islands that lie just north of the equator about three-quarters of the way from Hawaii to Indonesia, to the north of Papua New Guinea and the Solomon Islands and to the south of the Marshall Islands, the Northern Mariana Islands and Guam.

sights.title: Kosrae
sights.description: island in Federated States of Micronesia

sights.title: Pohnpei State
sights.description: state in Federated States of Micronesia

destinations.title: Palikir
destinations.description: Capital

destinations.title: Kolonia
destinations.description: (Pohnpei)

destinations.title: Weno
destinations.description: (formerly Moen)

destinations.title: Nan Madol
destinations.description: ruined city of Federated States of Micronesesia

destinations.title: Kapingamarangi
destinations.description: is the southernmost island group in FSM.

Moldova.title: Moldova
Moldova.summary: Moldova is a small land-locked country in Eastern Europe, north of the Balkans, surrounded by Romania to the southwest, across the Prut river, and Ukraine to the north and east. The largely unrecognised Transnistria occupies a sliver of the area bordering Ukraine east of the Nistru River.
Moldova.description: Moldova is a small land-locked country in Eastern Europe, north of the Balkans, surrounded by Romania to the southwest, across the Prut river, and Ukraine to the north and east. The largely unrecognised Transnistria occupies a sliver of the area bordering Ukraine east of the Nistru River.

sights.title: Purcari
sights.description: commune in Ștefan Vodă District, Moldova

destinations.title: Chişinău
destinations.description: capital - an administrative municipality (Municipiul). A nice city to go and visit for some days, and to walk around in.

destinations.title: Bălţi
destinations.description: merits a visit as well as the capital. Nice pedestrian zone around the central square. Check out the old part of the city.

destinations.title: Soroca
destinations.description: known as the "Romani (Gypsy) capital of Moldova." The hill on the west side of town has numerous ornately decorated Roma houses. The city also boasts the Soroca fort built by Stefan cel Mare in 1499. It was an important link in the chain of fortifications which today are located in Moldova and Ukraine along the Nistru river. Hours can be sporadic especially in the winter. On the road into town, 5 kilometres to the south of Soroca there is a Monument called “The Candle of Gratitude”. One can reach the 29.5 metres (98 feet) summit by walking up the 600 stairs.

destinations.title: Ungheni
destinations.description: border town to Romania with a bridge over the Prut river designed by Eiffel.

destinations.title: Comrat
destinations.description: in the southern wine zone of the country.

destinations.title: Cahul
destinations.description: historically the site of many battles, now known for its spas.

destinations.title: Orhei
destinations.description: fortified since the 6th century BC, it's also famous for its monastery.

destinations.title: Gagauzia
destinations.description: an autonomous region within Moldova.

Monaco.title: Monaco
Monaco.summary: The Principality of Monaco (French: Principauté de Monaco) is a city-state which lies between the Alps and the Mediterranean Sea, bounded by the French Riviera to the east and west, with the Italian Riviera only a few kilometres further to the east.
Monaco.description: The Principality of Monaco (French: Principauté de Monaco) is a city-state which lies between the Alps and the Mediterranean Sea, bounded by the French Riviera to the east and west, with the Italian Riviera only a few kilometres further to the east.

sights.title: Opéra de Monte-Carlo
sights.description: The Monaco Opera House or "Salle Garnier" was built by the famous architect Charles Garnier. The auditorium of the opera house is decorated in red and gold and has frescoes and sculptures all around the auditorium. Looking up to the ceiling of the auditorium, the visitor will be blown away by the superb paintings. The opera house is flamboyant but at the same time very beautiful. There have been some of the most superior international performances of ballet, opera and concerts held in the opera house for more than a century; consider taking in a show during your visit... but expect to pay top dollar!

sights.title: Monaco City
sights.description: Take a walk through Monaco-Ville, also known as “Le Rocher” or “The rock.” Monaco-Ville is still a medieval village at heart and an astonishingly picturesque site. It is made up almost entirely of pedestrian streets and passageways and most previous-century houses still remain. There a number of hotels, restaurant and souvenir shops tourists can stay, eat and shop at. You can also visit the Prince's Palace, the Cathedral, the Oceanographic Museum, the City Hall, and the Saint Martin Gardens.

sights.title: Prince's Palace of Monaco
sights.description: The Palais Princier is in old Monaco-Ville and is worth a visit. There are self-paced, audio-guided tours of the palace. The palace also offers a breathtaking panoramic view overlooking the Port and Monte-Carlo. Everyday at 11:55 AM, in front of the Palace's main entrance visitors can watch the changing of the guard ceremony performed by the "Carabiniers". “Carabiniers” are not only in charge of the princes’ security but they offer him a guard of honor and on special occasions, are his escorts. The “Compagnie des Carabiniers du Prince” has a military band (Fanfare), which performs at public concerts, official occasions, sports events and international military music festivals.

sights.title: St Martin Gardens
sights.description: Beautiful park along the ridge at the southern end of Le Rocher.

sights.title: Monaco Top Cars Collection
sights.description: For any car enthusiast this is the place to go. There is everything, from carriages and old cars to formula 1 race cars. Around 100 vehicles are on display here.

sights.title: Jardin Exotique de Monaco
sights.description: The Jardin Exotique is one of the many gardens Monaco has to offer. It is also one of Monaco’s finest tourist attractions. Several thousand rare plants from around the world are presented in a walking tour that is quite memorable for the views as well as the flora and plants. Due to the rise in altitude, not only are there many displays of desert plants but there are a handful of subtropical flora displays as well. There is also a grotto (cave) that has scheduled guided tours. The tour starts at the beginning of every hour and lasts for around 25 minutes. In the cave, you will have to climb the stairs equivalent to around a 6 storied building. You need to take bus number 2 to reach this Garden. You can take this bus either from the train station or from the Oceanographic Museum.

sights.title: La Condamine
sights.description:
is the second oldest district in Monaco, after Monaco-Ville. Here you can stop and marvel at the many luxurious yachts and cruise ships which usually adorn the docks in the marina. La Condamine is a thriving business district where you can visit the 43.73263357.41953021

 Condamine Market and the 43.7332677.4200121

 Rue Princesse Caroline pedestrian street. With enjoyable landscaped areas and modern buildings, La Condamine is surely worth a visit.

sights.title: Japanese Garden, Monaco
sights.description: The garden is 0.7 hectares in size, and features a stylised mountain, hill, waterfall, beach, brook, and a Zen garden for meditation. The garden was designed by Yasuo Beppu, the winner of the Flower Exhibition of Osaka 1990, as a miniature representation of Shintoist philosophy.

sights.title: New National Museum of Monaco
sights.description: Art exhibition at the second location of the New National Museum.

sights.title: Monte-Carlo Masters
sights.description: This tournament is held end of April each year at the Monte Carlo Country Club just outside of Monaco in Roquebrune-Cap-Martin. Rafael Nadal is the record holder.

sights.title: Monte-Carlo Sporting
sights.description: In the summer time, Monte-Carlo is illuminated with dazzling concerts at the exclusive Salle des Etoiles, which lies within the Sporting complex. It has featured such artist as Natalie Cole, Andrea Bocelli, the Beach Boys, Lionel Richie and Julio Iglesias among others. The club also hosts a small casino which includes basic casino games. With no one under the age of 18, the rate per person is 20€.

destinations.title: Cote d'Azur
destinations.description: like Èze, Nice, Antibes, Cannes

destinations.title: Saint Tropez
destinations.description: and Marseille

destinations.title: Italy
destinations.description: Genoa, Milan, et al.)

Mongolia.title: Mongolia
Mongolia.summary:
Mongolia, known as Mongol uls (Cyrillic: Монгол улс, Script: ᠮᠣᠩᠭ᠋ᠣᠯ
ᠤᠯᠤᠰ) in Mongolian, is a landlocked country located between China and Russia. It's a vast emptiness that links land and sky, and is one of the last few places on the planet where nomadic life is still a living tradition.
Mongolia.description:
Mongolia, known as Mongol uls (Cyrillic: Монгол улс, Script: ᠮᠣᠩᠭ᠋ᠣᠯ
ᠤᠯᠤᠰ) in Mongolian, is a landlocked country located between China and Russia. It's a vast emptiness that links land and sky, and is one of the last few places on the planet where nomadic life is still a living tradition.

sights.title: Dalanzadgad
sights.description: capital city and sum (district) of Ömnögovi Aimag, Mongolia

destinations.title: Ulaanbaatar
destinations.description: (Ulan Bator, Mongolian Cyrillic: Улаанбаатар) – the capital and starting point for most travel in this country.

destinations.title: Choibalsan
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Чойбалсан) – large industrial city in the East.

destinations.title: Erdenet
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Эрдэнэт) – Mongolia's second largest city and home to one of the world's biggest copper mines and a famous carpet factory

destinations.title: Hovd
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Ховд) – A historic city at the crossroads of traditional Mongol and Kazakh culture.

destinations.title: Karakorum
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Хархорум) – the ancient capital of the Mongol Empire, established by Genghis' son Ogedei.

destinations.title: Mörön
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Мөрөн) – Capital of Hövsgöl province.

destinations.title: Ölgii
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Өлгий) – a town in Mongolia's far western corner - capital of the Kazakh Region, Bayan-Ölgii province.

destinations.title: Öndörkhaan
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Чингис) – near the birthplace (and possible burial site) of Genghis Khan.

destinations.title: Tsetserleg
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Цэцэрлэг) – the capital of Arkhangai province.

destinations.title: Khognokhan mountain specially protected territory
destinations.description: – A beautiful, and calm area that includes cultural sightseeing places as Kharkhorin, The capital of the Mongolian Empire after Genghis Khan

destinations.title: Altai Tavan Bogd National Park
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Алтай Таван богд байгалийн цогцолбор газар) – The tallest mountain and largest glacier in Mongolia, with Eagle Hunters living in its shadow and a World Heritage Site: Petroglyphs.

destinations.title: Gun-Galuut Nature Reserve
destinations.description: – An ecotourism destination

destinations.title: Gorkhi-Terelj National Park
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Горхи-Тэрэлж) – A national park 70 km east of Ulaanbaatar

destinations.title: Khustain Nuruu National Park
destinations.description: (Mongolian: Хустайн нуруу) – Khustain Nuruu or Hustai National park is home to the Takhi wild horses (also known as Przewalski's Horse).  These are true wild horses which have never been domesticated.

destinations.title: Gobi Gurvan Saikhan National Park
destinations.description: (Mongolian Cyrillic: Говь гурван сайхан байгалийн цогцолбор газар) – Khongor Sand dunes, Yol Canyon, Bayanzag-Red Flamming Cliffs, Khermen Tsav.

destinations.title: Erlian
destinations.description: county-level city

Montenegro.description: Montenegro (Montenegrin: Crna Gora, Црна Гора) is a country in the Balkans, on the Adriatic Sea, home to 680,000 people.

destinations.title: Žabljak

destinations.title: Ulcinj

destinations.title: Bečići

Morocco.title: Morocco
Morocco.summary: Morocco (Arabic: المغرب Al-Maghrib; Berber: ⵍⵎⴰⵖⵔⵉⴱ Elmaɣrib) is a kingdom in North Africa, at the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea. Morocco has 34 million inhabitants, and a rich heritage from the Islamic Golden Age. For Europeans, Morocco has been, and remains, the gateway to Africa.
Morocco.description: Morocco (Arabic: المغرب Al-Maghrib; Berber: ⵍⵎⴰⵖⵔⵉⴱ Elmaɣrib) is a kingdom in North Africa, at the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea. Morocco has 34 million inhabitants, and a rich heritage from the Islamic Golden Age. For Europeans, Morocco has been, and remains, the gateway to Africa.

destinations.title: Rabat
destinations.description: (Arabic: الرِّبَاط, Berber: ⵕⵕⴱⴰⵟ) – The capital of Morocco; very relaxed and hassle-free, highlights include a 12th-century tower and minaret.

destinations.title: Agadir
destinations.description: (Arabic: اكادير, Berber: ⴰⴳⴰⴷⵉⵔ) – Agadir is best known for its beaches. The town is a nice example of modern Morocco, with less emphasis on history and culture. Take the local bus for a few cents and go 2 or 3 villages north, where there are additional beaches

destinations.title: Casablanca
destinations.description: (Arabic: الدار البيضاء, Berber: ⴰⵏⴼⴰ) – This modern city by the sea is a starting point for visitors flying into the country. If you have the time, both the historical medina and the contemporary mosque (the third largest in the world) are well worth an afternoon

destinations.title: Fez
destinations.description: (Arabic: فاس‎‎, Berber: ⴼⴰⵙ) – Fez is the former capital of Morocco and home to the oldest university in the world, the Qarawiyyin University, in its well preserved old city.

destinations.title: Marrakech
destinations.description: (Arabic: مراكش‎‎, Berber: ⴰⵎⵓⵔⴰⴽⵓⵛ) – Marrakech (also known as Marrakesh) is a perfect combination of old and new Morocco. Plan to spend at least a few days wandering the huge maze of souks and ruins in the medina. The great plaza of Djeema El Fna at dusk is not to be missed.

destinations.title: Meknes
destinations.description: (Arabic: مكناس, Berber: ⴰⵎⴽⵏⴰⵙ) – A modern, laid-back city that offers a welcome break from the tourist crush of neighbouring Fez.

destinations.title: Ouarzazate
destinations.description: (Arabic: ورزازات‎‎, Berber: ⵡⴰⵔⵣⴰⵣⴰⵜ) – Considered the capital of the South, Ouarzazate is a great example of preservation and tourism that hasn't destroyed the feel of a fantastic and ancient city.

destinations.title: Tangier
destinations.description: (Arabic: طنجة‎‎, Berber: ⵜⵉⵏⴳⵉ) – Tangier is the starting point for most visitors arriving by ferry from Spain. An enigmatic charm which has attracted numerous artists (Henri Matisse), musicians (Jimi Hendrix), politicians (Winston Churchill), writers (William S. Burroughs, Mark Twain) and others (Malcolm Forbes).

destinations.title: Tetouan
destinations.description: (Arabic: تطوان, Berber: ⵜⵉⵟⵟⴰⵡⵉⵏ) – Nice beaches and is the gateway to the Rif Mountains.

destinations.title: Chefchaouen
destinations.description: (Arabic: الشاون, Berber: ⴰⵛⵛⴰⵡⵏ) – A mountain town inland from Tangier full of white-washed winding alleys, blue doors, and olive trees, Chefchaouen is clean as a postcard and a welcome escape from Tangier, evoking the feeling of a Greek island

destinations.title: Essaouira
destinations.description: (Arabic: الصويرة, Berber: ⵎⵓⴳⴰⴷⵓⵔ) – An ancient sea-side town newly rediscovered by tourists. From mid-June to August the beaches are packed but any other time and you'll be the only person there. Good music and great people. Nearest Coast from Marrakech

destinations.title: High Atlas
destinations.description: (Arabic: الاطلس الكبير, Berber: ⴰⴷⵔⴰⵔ ⵏ ⴷⵔⵏ) – regular destination for mountain hikers, ski enthusiasts, or travellers interested in the indigenous Berber culture

destinations.title: Merzouga
destinations.description: (Arabic: مرزوقة, Berber: ⵎⴰⵔⵣⵓⴳⴰ) and M'Hamid (Arabic: محاميد الغزلان, Berber: ⵜⴰⵔⴰⴳⴰⵍⵜ) – From either of these two settlements at the edge of the Sahara, ride a camel or 4x4 into the desert for a night (or a week) among the dunes and under the stars

destinations.title: M'Hamid
destinations.description: (Arabic: مرزوقة, Berber: ⵎⴰⵔⵣⵓⴳⴰ) and  (Arabic: محاميد الغزلان, Berber: ⵜⴰⵔⴰⴳⴰⵍⵜ) – From either of these two settlements at the edge of the Sahara, ride a camel or 4x4 into the desert for a night (or a week) among the dunes and under the stars

destinations.title: Tinerhir
destinations.description: (Arabic: تنغير, Berber: ⵜⵉⵏⵖⵉⵔ) – Desert oasis and access point to the stunning High Atlas

destinations.title: Volubilis
destinations.description: (Arabic: وليلي, Berber: ⵡⴰⵍⵉⵍⵉ) – Also known as Wallibi and is 30 km north of Meknes, biggest Roman ruins in Morocco, next to the holy town Moulay Idriss

Mozambique.title: Mozambique
Mozambique.summary: Mozambique (Portuguese: Moçambique) is a country on the Indian Ocean coast of Southern Africa. It is bordered by South Africa to the south, Tanzania to the north and has inland borders with Eswatini (Swaziland), Malawi, Zambia, Zimbabwe. Mozambique's eastern coastline along the Indian Ocean is more than 1,000 km long, a fantastic draw for scuba divers, fishermen, sailors and beach lovers.
Mozambique.description: Mozambique (Portuguese: Moçambique) is a country on the Indian Ocean coast of Southern Africa. It is bordered by South Africa to the south, Tanzania to the north and has inland borders with Eswatini (Swaziland), Malawi, Zambia, Zimbabwe. Mozambique's eastern coastline along the Indian Ocean is more than 1,000 km long, a fantastic draw for scuba divers, fishermen, sailors and beach lovers.

destinations.title: Maputo

destinations.title: Beira

destinations.title: Inhambane

destinations.title: Nampula

destinations.title: Pemba

destinations.title: Bazaruto Archipelago

destinations.title: Ponta d'Ouro

destinations.description: at the north of the country, a scenic and secluded holiday destination off the beaten track with lush African bush on the mainland and white sand beaches/crystal blue water in the Archipelago and on the coast.  Accessible through Pemba.

destinations.title: Tofo Beach

destinations.title: Vilanculos

Myanmar.title: Myanmar
Myanmar.summary: Myanmar (မြန်မာပြည်), or Burma, officially the Republic of the Union of Myanmar (ပြည်ထောင်​စု သမ္မတ မြန်မာ​နိုင်​ငံတော်), is a country in Southeast Asia, bordering Bangladesh, India, China, Laos and Thailand to the east.

Nagorno-Karabakh.title: Nagorno-Karabakh
Nagorno-Karabakh.summary: Nagorno-Karabakh (Armenian: Լեռնային Ղարաբաղ; Azerbaijani: Dağlıq Qarabağ), officially the Republic of Artsakh, is a country in the Caucasus. It is internationally recognized as part of Azerbaijan, but is closely linked in every way to Armenia and accessible only through Armenia.
Nagorno-Karabakh.description: Nagorno-Karabakh (Armenian: Լեռնային Ղարաբաղ; Azerbaijani: Dağlıq Qarabağ), officially the Republic of Artsakh, is a country in the Caucasus. It is internationally recognized as part of Azerbaijan, but is closely linked in every way to Armenia and accessible only through Armenia.

destinations.title: Martakert

Namibia.title: Namibia
Namibia.summary: Namibia is in Southern Africa, bordering South Africa, Botswana, Angola, Zambia and the Atlantic Ocean. Namibia boasts remarkable natural attractions such as the Namib Desert, the Fish River Canyon Park, Etosha National Park and the Kalahari desert. Thanks to both a wealth of indigenous cultures and a tumultuous colonial history, its people speak nine different languages, including some of the Khoisan languages which include the 'clicks' that present an enigma to most native English speakers. It is also one of the few places in Africa where German, although not official, remains a commonly spoken language, while Afrikaans, shared with its southern neighbour, is also prevalent.

Nauru.title: Nauru
Nauru.summary: Nauru is a small island in the South Pacific Ocean south of the Marshall Islands and is the world's third-smallest country; only Monaco and the Vatican City are smaller. An off-the-beaten-track destination if there ever was one, Nauru is also one of the least visited countries in the world, with about only 200 tourists a year. The remoteness and that much of the island is a charmless open phosphate mine are two strong reasons for this.

Nepal.title: Nepal
Nepal.summary: Nepal (Nepali: नेपाल) is a landlocked country in the Himalayas in South Asia, bordering India and the Tibet autonomous region of China. It has eight of the world's 10 highest peaks, including Mount Everest, the world's tallest, on the border with Tibet, as well as Lumbini, the birthplace of Gautama Buddha, the founder of Buddhism. In 2008, Nepal was declared a republic and abolished its monarchy.
Nepal.description: Nepal (Nepali: नेपाल) is a landlocked country in the Himalayas in South Asia, bordering India and the Tibet autonomous region of China. It has eight of the world's 10 highest peaks, including Mount Everest, the world's tallest, on the border with Tibet, as well as Lumbini, the birthplace of Gautama Buddha, the founder of Buddhism. In 2008, Nepal was declared a republic and abolished its monarchy.

destinations.title: Mount Kailash
destinations.description: in Tibet, a short distance beyond the North West corner of Nepal. Hindu and Buddhist cosmology describes the cosmos as a central mountain, Mount Meru, surrounded by the earth's continents and seas, then by the rest of the universe. Cambodia's Angkor Wat temple complex is an architectural representation of this schema. As geographical knowledge developed, Mount Kailash was proclaimed the physical manifestation of Mount Meru. It is the hydrological hub of the subcontinent. The Karnali, Sutlej Indus and Brahmaputra rivers all begin near this mountain. Hindus and Buddhists gain religious merit by circumnambulating the mountain.

Netherlands.title: Netherlands
Netherlands.summary: The Netherlands (Dutch: Nederland) is a charming small country in the low-lying river delta of northwestern Europe. Its landscape of famously flat lands, much of it reclaimed from the sea, is dotted with windmills, blooming tulip fields and picturesque villages. With over 17 million people living in a relatively small area, this is a densely populated modern European country. Still, even the largest of its cities have retained a rather laid-back small-town atmosphere and many are packed with historic heritage.

New Zealand.title: New Zealand
New Zealand.summary: New Zealand (Māori: Aotearoa) is one of the most beautiful countries in the world, a country of stunning and diverse natural beauty: jagged mountains, rolling pasture land, steep fiords, pristine trout-filled lakes, raging rivers, scenic beaches, and active volcanic zones.  These islands form a unique bioregion inhabited by flightless birds seen nowhere else, such as kakapo and kiwi. New Zealanders have adopted the kiwi as a national symbol, and have even taken the word Kiwi as a name for themselves.

New Zealanders have adopted the kiwi as a national symbol, and have even taken the word Kiwi as a name for themselves.

Nicaragua.title: Nicaragua
Nicaragua.summary: Nicaragua is the largest country in Central America by area at 130,373 km2 and the least densely populated. It has coastlines on the Caribbean Sea in the East and the Pacific Ocean in the west. It borders Costa Rica in the south and Honduras in the north. Nicaraguans (or "Nicas" as they are often called) like to refer to their country as the "país de lagos y volcanes"; the country of lakes and volcanoes. And those are indeed striking features as Nicaragua contains the largest freshwater body in Central America, Lake Nicaragua or Cocibolca. Inside Lake Nicaragua the famed Volcano Concepcion on Ometepe rises to about a mile in altitude, but other volcanoes such as Momotombo or Mombacho are also impressive.

Niger.title: Niger
Niger.summary: Niger (pronounced: nee-ZHAIR) is an arid, landlocked country of the Sahel with a population of 20 million.  It is bordered by Algeria, Mali, Burkina Faso, Benin, Nigeria, Chad and Libya.  Niger is a former French colony which was granted independence in 1960.  The land is mostly desert plains and dunes, with rolling savanna in the southeast with nothing much to see.

Nigeria.title: Nigeria
Nigeria.summary: Nigeria (Hausa: Nijeriya, Igbo: Naíjíríà, Yoruba: Nàìjíríà) is a large country in equatorial West Africa. It is the continent's most populous nation.  It has a southern coastline on the Gulf of Guinea, and has Benin to the west, Cameroon to the southeast, Chad to the northeast, and Niger to the north. It is Africa's most populous country and the world's 7th most populous, and also the largest oil producer and largest economy in Africa. Often regarded as the giant of Africa, Nigeria along with South Africa is also one of the most important countries on the African continent, with delicious cuisines and great tourist attractions. Although the northern parts of the country may be dangerous due to the influence of an Islamist rebel group ISWAP, also called Boko Haram.

North Korea.title: North Korea
North Korea.summary: North Korea (Korean: 조선 Chosŏn), officially the Democratic People's Republic of Korea or DPRK (조선민주주의인민공화국 Chosŏn Minjujuŭi Inmin Konghwaguk) is a country in East Asia on the northern half of the Korean Peninsula, lying between Korea Bay and the East Sea (Sea of Japan). It borders China to the north, Russia to the north east and South Korea to the south.

Northern Cyprus.title: Northern Cyprus
Northern Cyprus.summary: The Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus (TRNC, Turkish Kuzey Kıbrıs Türk Cumhuriyeti) is a republic on the northern and eastern side of the island of Cyprus.  Turkey is the only state which recognizes the TRNC.  Cyprus is an island in the Mediterranean Sea, south of Turkey. After Sicily and Sardinia, Cyprus is the third largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.

Norway.title: Norway
Norway.summary: Norway (Norwegian: Norge or Noreg) is the westernmost, northernmost — and surprisingly also the easternmost — of the three Scandinavian countries. Norway is known for the complex and deep fjords along its west coast, as well as the midnight sun and Northern Lights. Mainland Norway stretches from the North Sea near Denmark and Scotland to borders with northern Finland and the northwestern tip of Russia, and has a long border with Sweden to the east. Norway also includes the Svalbard islands in the Arctic.

destinations.title: Oslo
destinations.description: – the capital and largest city of Norway, with museums of national importance, a beautiful setting and lively nightlife and cultural scene.

destinations.title: Bergen
destinations.description: – Once the capital of Norway, old Hanseatic trading centre with a rich culture and dramatic scenery, Norway's second largest city. Wonderfully cute wooden buildings, a magnificent mountain setting, varied nightlife and lots of atmosphere. This is your gateway to the western fjords. The city has been dubbed "the rainiest city in Europe" with an average of 250 days of rainfall a year. Bring an umbrella.

destinations.title: Bodø
destinations.description: – The gateway to the magnificent Lofoten islands. And the place of Saltstraumen, the worlds strongest maelstrom.

destinations.title: Drammen
destinations.description: – Once known as industrial and grimy, but refurbishment has made Drammen an enjoyable side trip from Oslo.

destinations.title: Fredrikstad
destinations.description: – A magnificent old town stands out from the rest of the rather nondescript city. Brilliant as a day trip from Oslo.

destinations.title: Kristiansand
destinations.description: – The jolly capital of the South. Best known for the family attraction Kristiansand zoo and amusement park and as Norway's "cool riviera".

destinations.title: Stavanger
destinations.description: – The fourth largest city, and the third largest urban area. Commercially important due to the oil business. The wooden, cobbled central area is one of the most charming places in Norway. Home to one of Norway's medieval churches, you can also visit Iron Age homes, stone age caves, and sites where the Viking kings used to meet at Ullandhaugtårnet. Stavanger is where Erik the Red was born.

destinations.title: Tromsø
destinations.description: – A magnificent, modern cathedral and absolutely no polar bears roaming the streets.

destinations.title: Trondheim
destinations.description: – Famous for its stunning cathedral (Nidarosdomen). Wonderful riverside wharfs, wooden buildings and the best student nightlife in Norway give beautiful, leafy Trondheim its charm.

destinations.title: Atlanterhavsveien
destinations.description: – The Atlantic Ocean Road is a spectacular road with bridges along islands and skerries on the edge of the Atlantic Ocean.

destinations.title: Hardangervidda
destinations.description: – Norway's largest national park on a large highland plateau.

destinations.title: Jostedalsbreen
destinations.description: – The largest glacier on the European mainland.

destinations.title: Jotunheimen
destinations.description: – A majestic landscape and home of Norway's highest mountains.

destinations.title: Lofoten
destinations.description: – Experience the midnight sun in this traditional fishing district in the northern province with islands and mountains.

destinations.title: Nordkapp
destinations.description: – This cliff is the northernmost point of continental Europe, overlooking the Barents ocean.

destinations.title: Sognefjorden
destinations.description: – Glaciers, mountains and picturesque settlements are but a few of the sights on the Sognefjord. Flåm and Nærøyfjorden (also a UNESCO World Heritage site) are parts of the mighty Sognefjorden system.

Oman.title: Oman
Oman.summary: The Middle East Sultanate of Oman (Arabic: سلطنة عُمان) is on the eastern side of the Arabian Peninsula. It borders the United Arab Emirates in the northwest, Saudi Arabia in the west, and Yemen in the southwest. Oman has two exclaves separated from it by the United Arab Emirates, the Musandam Peninsula and Madha.

Pakistan.title: Pakistan
Pakistan.summary: The Islamic Republic of  Pakistan (Urdu: پاکستان) is in South Asia and is the world's 34th largest country by size. With a population exceeding 180 million people, it is the sixth most populous country in the world. Pakistan is strategically located astride the ancient trade routes of the Khyber and Bolan passes between South Asia and Central Asia. Another pass, which now has the Karakoram Highway through it, leads to Western China. All these passes, and some ports in Pakistan, formed part of the ancient Silk Road which linked Asia and Europe.

Palau.summary: Palau (Belau) is a group of more than 500 islands, covering 458km², in the Micronesia area of Oceania, to the southeast of the Philippines.

Palestinian territories.title: Palestinian territories
Palestinian territories.summary: The Palestinian territories consist of two physically separate entities, the West Bank and the Gaza Strip, in the Middle East. While not yet universally considered part of any sovereign nation, since November 2012, the Palestinian Authority has been upgraded to observer-state status by the United Nations. The Palestinian territories have all been under varying degrees of Israeli governance since 1967, and the final status of the territory remains the subject of ongoing and future negotiations.

Panama.title: Panama
Panama.summary: Panama is a country in Central America with coastlines on the Caribbean Sea and the North Pacific Ocean. It has land borders with Colombia (and South America) to the southeast and Costa Rica to the northwest. Its location on the isthmus that forms the land bridge connecting North and South America has been militarily strategic through history. It controls the Panama Canal that links the North Atlantic Ocean via the Caribbean Sea with the North Pacific Ocean, one of the most important shipping routes in the world.

It has land borders with Colombia (and South America) to the southeast and Costa Rica to the northwest. Its location on the isthmus that forms the land bridge connecting North and South America has been militarily strategic through history. destinations.description: is Panama's second largest park, covering over 850 square miles (207,000 hectares). It is a bi-national park, as an additional 193,929 hectares stretch to the Costa Rica side. Amistad is the Spanish word for friendship and it was create to promote friendship between the two countries.

destinations.description: in the Gulf of Chiriqui, is dotted with dozens of small islands and islets, including Boca Brava, Isla Palenque, and Islas Secas. The area has some of the best sport fishing and whale watching in the region, and several resorts and boutique hotels have opened in the area since the mid-2000s.

destinations.title: El Valle

destinations.description: National Park — 35,000 acres/14,325 hectares in size, and Panama's highest peak at 11,401 feet/3,475 meters is here.

Papua New Guinea.title: Papua New Guinea
Papua New Guinea.summary: Papua New Guinea (Tok Pisin: Papua Niugini; Hiri Motu: Papua Niu Gini), officially the Independent State of Papua New Guinea (Tok Pisin: Independen Stet bilong Papua Niugini)  comprises the eastern part of the world's largest and highest tropical island, New Guinea, together with many smaller offshore islands. It has a long and un-policed land border with the Papua region of Indonesia to the west.
Papua New Guinea.description: Papua New Guinea (Tok Pisin: Papua Niugini; Hiri Motu: Papua Niu Gini), officially the Independent State of Papua New Guinea (Tok Pisin: Independen Stet bilong Papua Niugini)  comprises the eastern part of the world's largest and highest tropical island, New Guinea, together with many smaller offshore islands. It has a long and un-policed land border with the Papua region of Indonesia to the west.
